member.name: M:MSharp.AssociationFormElement.MaximumOptions(System.Nullable{System.Int32})
member.summary:
The number value specified in this attribute will enforce the minim numbers of relations records that must be added. This value overrides the number set in modal.
======== DEFAULT ================================
0 or as specified in Modal
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you want to enforce minimum numbers if relational records
======== EXAMPLES ===============================

member.name: M:MSharp.AssociationFormElement.MaxCardinality(System.Nullable{System.Int32})
member.summary:
The number value specified in this attribute will limit the maximum numbers of relations records that can be added. Add button for relation data grid will be made hidden once the number of records specified in this attribute is reached.
This value overrides the value set in Modal
======== DEFAULT ================================
10 or as sepecified in Modal
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you want to limit the insertion of maximum numbers of relational records

member.name: M:MSharp.AssociationFormElement.CustomDataSave(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field, you can specify a C# expression which will be used to populate the related entity property when saving form data
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need to perform custom logic specific to UI for saving the input data especially based on custom added control on the form. Any Business logic must be written in Modal.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
this.User = App.Context.User

member.name: M:MSharp.AssociationFormElement.InitialCardinality(System.Nullable{System.Int32})
member.summary:
This attribute controls the number of rows shown in the grid of relational object instances initially
e.g. Specify a value of 1 will make the first row of relational data grid visible and so on for other numbers
======== DEFAULT ================================
0
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you want to show rows of relation data grid. This is also useful to display rows for minimum cardinality
======== =======================================

In this field you can specify a criteria which act as a where clause on options data source.

member.summary:
A string C# statement to represent each item in the list.

By default the ToString() value of each item is represented in the list.

In this example, ....

member.name: M:MSharp.AssociationFormElement.DataSource(System.String)
member.summary:
This field is a C# expression that requires a collection type objects.
If this field is not set all instances of the type will be shown as option.
These lookup up options will be shown as the options to add a relation.
Note:
For master detail forms this field is ignored.
======== DEFAULT ================================
All instance of the associated type are loaded
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
You can use this attribute to provide filtered Dataset
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
Example 1
Item.Languages;
Example 2
Item.MostVisitedcategories()

member.summary:
IF set to False, header for the grid of the relation object instances will not be shown.
======== DEFAULT ================================
True
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
Use this attribute to show / hide the headers for the grid of the relation object instances.

member.name: M:MSharp.AssociationFormElement.Label(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field you can specify the label text for this form element.
Note:
- If you are manually setting this field, The system will not automatically add ":" to the end of the label.
- if you don't want to display a label then use [#EMPTY#] keyword
======== DEFAULT ================================
This is a mandatory field for the elements.
The label is set to the "Title" of the property by default.
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you want to set a custom label for the form element.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
"Email Address"
c#: string.Format("Email address for {0}" + Item.Name)

member.name: M:MSharp.AssociationFormElement.SortFormula(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field you can specify the sort expression for the relation data.
Supported formats:
-
Property name
- Any C# expression using "item" object.
Tips:
- Use "|" to seperate multiple sort expressions.
-
You can add " DESC" to the end of each phrase to specify descending sort.
======== DEFAULT ================================
By default items in this form element will be sorted based on the same as the default sort order of the "Referenced type by this association".
That is, either by an explicitly defined SortOrder on that Type, or the ToString() of the objects.
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you want the items to be sorted in this form element (dropdown list, etc) differently from the default setting of the referenced type.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
LastName
item.LastName
item.GetLastName()
item.GetLastName() DESC
item.LastName + ", " + item.FirstName
LastName DESC | item.GetSomething()
FirstName DESC | LastName | MyModuleMethod(item) DESC

member.name: M:MSharp.AssociationFormElement.IsMerged(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
If this field is checked the following scenario will be run:
The form supposed that only ONE relation entry is required and adds the relation entry within the form entry form. (not as a separate form).
Note:
In this case the end user will be unable to add more than one relation to the entity and only one relation will be added to the entity.
======== DEFAULT ================================
False
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you want to merge the relation form intro parent form

member.summary:

======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================

======== EXAMPLES ===============================
Password should be at least 8 characters long.

member.name: M:MSharp.AssociationFormElement.ControlCssClass(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field, you can set a css class for this control.
Tips:
- css classes should always be lower case.
- Use "-" to separate the words in the css class.
- Use " " to separate multiple css classes.
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When an special appearance style is needed for the control.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
rounded-textbox
short-textbox rounded-textbox
c#: (Case != null) ? "selected-textbox" : ""

member.name: M:MSharp.AssociationFormElement.Control(MSharp.ControlType)
member.summary:
In this field, you can select a control type from a wide range of control types for the input control e.g AutoComplete, Textbox, Checkbox List etc
======== DEFAULT ================================
Textbox for string or numeric fields
Dropdown List for collection type associations and nullable Boolean field
Checkbox for radio button
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need to change the type of input control for the form element
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
For Boolean type fields, Checkbox is displayed by default but you can select Radio Button with Yes / No option

member.name: M:MSharp.AssociationFormElement.WatermarkText(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field you can specify text for watermark which hovered above the input control. This field supports both static text and C# expression.
Note:
- This attribute is ignored for some of the control types e.g. Dropdown lists, Checkboxes etc
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need to hover some information to educate user about the form field which disappareas as the field is focused

member.name: M:MSharp.AssociationFormElement.ToolTip(System.String)
member.summary:
The text or markup to use for the tooltip of the control. You can use static or C# expression
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need to display tooltip for the form element
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
Static Text
Valid Email address
Example 2
c#: App.Settings.Current.EmailAddressTooltip

member.name: M:MSharp.AssociationFormElement.Readonly(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
When set, a literal will be generated instead of a data entry control.
======== DEFAULT ================================
False
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you intend to just display the data for read only purposes
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
You have a property the value of which is automatically generated and you just want to display the generated value on the Form.

member.name: M:MSharp.AssociationFormElement.Box(MSharp.ModuleBox)
member.summary:
In this field you can select a box available in element section. On selecting a box, the form element will be placed inside that box
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need to fulfil custom design or want to group related search elements
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
You need to display form elements in groups with a heading
You need to display form elements in left and right combinations

member.name: M:MSharp.AssociationFormElement.ReloadOnChange(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
If set to True, the input control will cause postback.
======== DEFAULT ================================
False
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need to enable the postback behaviour of the input control
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
Dropdown lists for data filtering

member.name: M:MSharp.AssociationFormElement.ChangeEventHandler(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field you can specify a C# expression to handle the change event of the input control
Tips:
- Make sure the Post back attribute is set to True
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need to perform custom logic on change event of a form element
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
Filtering products when category is changed
lstProducts.Datasource = lstCategory.GetSelected ().Products;

member.name: M:MSharp.AssociationFormElement.ExtraControlAttributes(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field you can specify the code to be added to the control markup.
Notes:
- Use this only for values that cannot be set through the M# interface.
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need to customize input control markup with additional attributes not available in M#
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
TextMode="Password"
EnableViewState="False"

member.summary:
In this field, you can set a css class for this item.

- css classes should always be lower case.
- Use "-" to separate the words in the css class.

member.name: M:MSharp.AssociationFormElement.Mandatory(System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary:
This attribute allows to make a form element mandatory or optional. This attribute overrides behaviour set in Modal.
Note:
If you change a form element which was marked as mandatory in Modal to optional by setting this attribute to False. Then the element will not be validated on client side but server side validation will take place as set.
======== AS SET IN MODAL AT THE TIME OF CREATING PROPERTY
TODO: Describe...
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need to make a form element mandatory on UI.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
You have an option comment field but want to make it mandatory for a specific form

member.name: M:MSharp.AssociationFormElement.CustomInitializer(System.String)

In this field, you can specify a C# expression to initialize the input control. The expression specified here will be used to populate input control on page load.

In scenarios when you need to initialize the input control especially custom control added on the form.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================

member.name: M:MSharp.AssociationFormElement.AutoFocus(System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary:
This attribute allows to to specify the auto focus behaviour of the input control
Often on lengthy pages if form is below the browser normal window and control focus causes unnecessary page scroll to show the default focused element you can use this property to set the
AutoFocus to False. which will prevent page to scroll on load
======== DEFAULT ================================
First element of the form receives the focus when the page is loaded.
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need to alter the control Auto focus

member.summary:
This field works only with QueryString value. When set to True, it directly extracts the value from the QuerySting without performing a null check

This attribute allows to make a form element mandatory or optional. This attribute overrides behaviour set in Modal.
Note:
If you change a form element which was marked as mandatory in Modal to optional by setting this attribute to False. Then the element will not be validated on client side but server side validation will take place as set.

member.name: M:MSharp.BinaryFormElement.AutoFocus(System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary:
This attribute allows to to specify the auto focus behaviour of the input control
Often on lengthy pages if form is below the browser normal window and control focus causes unnecessary page scroll to show the default focused element you can use this property to set the
AutoFocus to False. which will prevent page to scroll on load
======== DEFAULT ================================
First element of the form receives the focus when the page is loaded.
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need to alter the control Auto focus

member.name: M:MSharp.BooleanFormElement.TrueText(System.String)
member.summary:
In this attribute you can specify a text for the "True" state of a Boolean element. This value overrides the same attribute value specified in Modal.
Note:
M# displays a checkbox input control by default for bool properties. But, when the value for this attribute is specified then a radio button input control is rendered with the specified text.
======== DEFAULT ================================
Yes
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you want to show a radio button with the text for "True" state of a bool value

member.name: M:MSharp.BooleanFormElement.AfterControl(System.String)
member.summary:
You can specify static contents or a C# expression which will be rendered just after the input control of this form element.
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need to apply special design requirements.You can also use this attribute to place module buttons.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
Placing the Find Button after Postcode textbox
[#BUTTONS(Find)#]
Suggesting Mandatory Fields with an asterix (*)
(*)

member.name: M:MSharp.BooleanFormElement.FalseText(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field you can specify a text for the "False" state of the Boolean element. This value overrides the same attribute value specified in Modal
Note:
M# displays a checkbox input control by default for bool properties. But, when the value for this attribute is specified then a radio button input control is rendered with the specified text.
======== DEFAULT ================================
No
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you want to render radio button with the custom text on "False" State of bool element

member.name: M:MSharp.BooleanFormElement.NullText(System.String)
member.summary:
This attribute works will nullable bool type. You can specify a text for the UNKNOWN state of the element. This value overrides the same attribute value specified in Modal
Note:
M# displays a checkbox input control by default for nullable bool properties. But, when the value for this attribute is specified then a dropdown list is rendered with the specified text.
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you want textual representation of a nullable bool element when the state is null / unknown

member.name: M:MSharp.BooleanFormElement.Label(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field you can specify the label text for this form element.
Note:
- If you are manually setting this field, The system will not automatically add ":" to the end of the label.
- if you don't want to display a label then use [#EMPTY#] keyword
======== DEFAULT ================================
This is a mandatory field for the elements.
The label is set to the "Title" of the property by default.
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you want to set a custom label for the form element.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
"Email Address"
c#: string.Format("Email address for {0}" + Item.Name)

member.summary:
In this field, you can select a control type from a wide range of control types for the input control e.g AutoComplete, Textbox, Checkbox List etc
======== DEFAULT ================================
Textbox for string or numeric fields
Dropdown List for collection type associations and nullable Boolean field
Checkbox for radio button

This attribute allows to to specify the auto focus behaviour of the input control

First element of the form receives the focus when the page is loaded.

When you need to alter the control Auto focus

member.name: M:MSharp.FormModule`1.RequestParam(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field you can specify a QueryString key which is used to retrieve the "ID" of the instance which needs to be edited on the page.
Tips:
- use QueryString Keys without prefixing with "." when you need to load an instance which will be directly consumed on the form.
- Prefixing QueryString keys with "." when you need to load an instance which will be used indirectly on the form e.g. in order to populate a form field
======== DEFAULT ================================
Id
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you as using more than one forms on the page and cannot use "id" as the QueryString to load instances for both forms.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
product
member

member.summary:
This attribute lets to choose the warning style(s) for validation message. You can use combination of styles.

After Control and Message Box
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need to select a different warning style for making validation warnings more sophisticated

member.name: M:MSharp.FormModule`1.KeepOriginalFormatting(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
When set to True, the generated code will not be formatted and will be generated left aligned.
======== DEFAULT ================================
False
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
It is recommended to not to set it True, because it keeping the original formatting will make it difficult to read an understand

False

When you need to enable multi-lingual support on a single module. Please not that if the Multi-Lingual option in project settings is set then you do not need to set it explicitly.

member.summary:
You can specify static contents or a C# expression which will be rendered just before the label of this form element.
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need to apply special design requirements.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
Suggesting Mandatory Fields with an asterix (*)
(*)

member.name: M:MSharp.GenericFormElement.AfterControlContainer(System.String)
member.summary:
You can specify static contents or a C# expression which will be rendered just after the input control container element of this form element.
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need to apply special design requirements.You can also use this attribute to place module buttons.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
Placing the Find Button after Postcode textbox
[#BUTTONS(Find)#]
Suggesting Password Strength

member.name: M:MSharp.GenericFormElement.BeforeControl(System.String)
member.summary:
You can specify static contents or a C# expression which will be rendered just before the input control of this form element.
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need to apply special design requirements.You can also use this attribute to place module buttons.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
Placing the Find Button before Postcode textbox
[#BUTTONS(Find)#]
Suggesting Mandatory Fields with an asterix (*)
(*)

member.name: M:MSharp.GenericFormElement.HeaderText(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field you can specify a static contents or C# expression which appear just above for form element container.
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need to display contents as heading of the element
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
Static Contents
======== PERSONAL DETAILS =======================
C# Expression
======== =======================================

member.name: M:MSharp.GenericFormElement.Label(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field you can specify the label text for this form element.
Note:
- If you are manually setting this field, The system will not automatically add ":" to the end of the label.
- if you don't want to display a label then use [#EMPTY#] keyword
======== DEFAULT ================================
This is a mandatory field for the elements.
The label is set to the "Title" of the property by default.
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you want to set a custom label for the form element.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
"Email Address"
c#: string.Format("Email address for {0}" + Item.Name)

member.name: M:MSharp.GenericFormElement.HelpText(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field you can specify the instructions to show to the user for this form element.
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need to show some instruction/help text for the form element.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
Password should be at least 8 characters long.
c#: string.Format("Help for {0}th user", App.Context.Users.Count() + 1)

member.name: M:MSharp.GenericFormElement.ControlCssClass(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field, you can set a css class for this control.
Tips:
- css classes should always be lower case.
- Use "-" to separate the words in the css class.
- Use " " to separate multiple css classes.
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When an special appearance style is needed for the control.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
rounded-textbox
short-textbox rounded-textbox
c#: (Case != null) ? "selected-textbox" : ""

member.name: M:MSharp.GenericFormElement.Control(MSharp.ControlType)
member.summary:
In this field, you can select a control type from a wide range of control types for the input control e.g AutoComplete, Textbox, Checkbox List etc
======== DEFAULT ================================
Textbox for string or numeric fields
Dropdown List for collection type associations and nullable Boolean field
Checkbox for radio button
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need to change the type of input control for the form element
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
For Boolean type fields, Checkbox is displayed by default but you can select Radio Button with Yes / No option

member.name: M:MSharp.GenericFormElement.WatermarkText(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field you can specify text for watermark which hovered above the input control. This field supports both static text and C# expression.
Note:
- This attribute is ignored for some of the control types e.g. Dropdown lists, Checkboxes etc
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need to hover some information to educate user about the form field which disappareas as the field is focused

member.name: M:MSharp.GenericFormElement.ToolTip(System.String)
member.summary:
The text or markup to use for the tooltip of the control. You can use static or C# expression
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need to display tooltip for the form element
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
Static Text
Valid Email address
Example 2
c#: App.Settings.Current.EmailAddressTooltip

member.name: M:MSharp.GenericFormElement.Readonly(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
When set, a literal will be generated instead of a data entry control.
======== DEFAULT ================================
False
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you intend to just display the data for read only purposes
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
You have a property the value of which is automatically generated and you just want to display the generated value on the Form.

member.name: M:MSharp.GenericFormElement.Box(MSharp.ModuleBox)
member.summary:
In this field you can select a box available in element section. On selecting a box, the form element will be placed inside that box
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need to fulfil custom design or want to group related search elements
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
You need to display form elements in groups with a heading
You need to display form elements in left and right combinations

member.name: M:MSharp.GenericFormElement.ReloadOnChange(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
If set to True, the input control will cause postback.
======== DEFAULT ================================
False
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need to enable the postback behaviour of the input control
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
Dropdown lists for data filtering

member.name: M:MSharp.GenericFormElement.ChangeEventHandler(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field you can specify a C# expression to handle the change event of the input control
Tips:
- Make sure the Post back attribute is set to True
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need to perform custom logic on change event of a form element
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
Filtering products when category is changed
lstProducts.Datasource = lstCategory.GetSelected ().Products;

member.name: M:MSharp.GenericFormElement.ExtraControlAttributes(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field you can specify the code to be added to the control markup.
Notes:
- Use this only for values that cannot be set through the M# interface.
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need to customize input control markup with additional attributes not available in M#
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
TextMode="Password"
EnableViewState="False"

member.name: M:MSharp.GenericFormElement.ItemCssClass(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field, you can set a css class for this item.
Tips:
- css classes should always be lower case.
- Use "-" to separate the words in the css class.
- Use " " to separate multiple css classes.
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When an special appearance style is needed for the item.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
test-item
short-item test-item
c#: (Case != null) ? "case-item" : ""

member.name: M:MSharp.GenericFormElement.Mandatory(System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary:
This attribute allows to make a form element mandatory or optional. This attribute overrides behaviour set in Modal.
Note:
If you change a form element which was marked as mandatory in Modal to optional by setting this attribute to False. Then the element will not be validated on client side but server side validation will take place as set.
======== AS SET IN MODAL AT THE TIME OF CREATING PROPERTY
TODO: Describe...
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need to make a form element mandatory on UI.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
You have an option comment field but want to make it mandatory for a specific form

member.name: M:MSharp.GenericFormElement.CustomInitializer(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field, you can specify a C# expression to initialize the input control. The expression specified here will be used to populate input control on page load.
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
In scenarios when you need to initialize the input control especially custom control added on the form.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
You want to load Categories for a custom added dropdown list
lstCategories.DataSource = Categories;

member.name: M:MSharp.GenericFormElement.LabelCssClass(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field, you can set a css class for this label.
Tips:
- css classes should always be lower case.
- Use "-" to separate the words in the css class.
- Use " " to separate multiple css classes.
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When an special appearance style is needed for the label
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
test-label
short-label test-label
c#: (Case != null) ? "case-label" : ""

member.name: M:MSharp.GenericFormElement.ControlWrapperCssClass(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field, you can enter a custom css class for the wrapper of the input control.
Tips:
- css classes should always be lower case.
- Use "-" to separate the words in the css class.
- Use " " to separate multiple css classes.
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you want to wrap the data entry control for a special appearance style.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
add-user-wrapper
leftside
add-user-wrapper
c#: (Case != null) ? "case-user-wrapper" : ""

member.name: M:MSharp.GenericFormElement.CustomDataLoad(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field you can write a custom c# code which loads the element before data entry.
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you want to replace the default data load with custom expression for the input control.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
txtCaseCount = App.Context.User.Cases.Count();

member.name: M:MSharp.GenericFormElement.AutoFocus(System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary:
This attribute allows to to specify the auto focus behaviour of the input control
Often on lengthy pages if form is below the browser normal window and control focus causes unnecessary page scroll to show the default focused element you can use this property to set the
AutoFocus to False. which will prevent page to scroll on load
======== DEFAULT ================================
First element of the form receives the focus when the page is loaded.
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need to alter the control Auto focus

member.name: M:MSharp.NumberFormElement.EnableNullSelection(System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary:
If set to true, null vale will be allowed to select from the populated list items
Tips:
This attribute works in junction with populate Items Codes
======== DEFAULT ================================
False
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you display a list of option using populate items code and want to display a null option
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
You have a nullable field in a survey form and want to allow user to select no option
You have form for profile management and display a list of secondary language as the nullable field

member.name: M:MSharp.NumberFormElement.AfterControl(System.String)
member.summary:
You can specify static contents or a C# expression which will be rendered just after the input control of this form element.
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need to apply special design requirements.You can also use this attribute to place module buttons.

[#BUTTONS(Find)#]
Suggesting Mandatory Fields with an asterix (*)
(*)

member.name: M:MSharp.NumberFormElement.DataSource(System.String)
M:MSharp.NumberFormElement.CustomDataSave(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field, you can specify a C# expression which will be used to populate the related entity property when saving form data
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need to perform custom logic specific to UI for saving the input data especially based on custom added control on the form. Any Business logic must be written in Modal.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
this.User = App.Context.User

member.name: M:MSharp.NumberFormElement.RequiredValidationMessage(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field you can specify required field validation message for the element
======== DEFAULT ================================
Please provide a value for [Form Element Name]
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need to display a custom required field message
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
Static Text
Name field is required.
C# Expression:

- This attribute is ignored for some of the control types e.g. Dropdown lists, Checkboxes etc
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need to hover some information to educate user about the form field which disappareas as the field is focused

member.name: M:MSharp.StringFormElement.ToolTip(System.String)
member.summary:
The text or markup to use for the tooltip of the control. You can use static or C# expression
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need to display tooltip for the form element
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
Static Text
Valid Email address
Example 2
c#: App.Settings.Current.EmailAddressTooltip

member.name: M:MSharp.StringFormElement.Readonly(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
When set, a literal will be generated instead of a data entry control.
======== DEFAULT ================================
False
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you intend to just display the data for read only purposes
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
You have a property the value of which is automatically generated and you just want to display the generated value on the Form.

member.name: M:MSharp.StringFormElement.Box(MSharp.ModuleBox)
member.summary:
In this field you can select a box available in element section. On selecting a box, the form element will be placed inside that box
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need to fulfil custom design or want to group related search elements
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
You need to display form elements in groups with a heading
You need to display form elements in left and right combinations

member.name: M:MSharp.StringFormElement.ReloadOnChange(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
If set to True, the input control will cause postback.
======== DEFAULT ================================
False
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need to enable the postback behaviour of the input control
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
Dropdown lists for data filtering

member.name: M:MSharp.StringFormElement.ChangeEventHandler(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field you can specify a C# expression to handle the change event of the input control
Tips:
- Make sure the Post back attribute is set to True
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need to perform custom logic on change event of a form element
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
Filtering products when category is changed
lstProducts.Datasource = lstCategory.GetSelected ().Products;

member.name: M:MSharp.StringFormElement.ExtraControlAttributes(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field you can specify the code to be added to the control markup.
Notes:
- Use this only for values that cannot be set through the M# interface.
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need to customize input control markup with additional attributes not available in M#
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
TextMode="Password"
EnableViewState="False"

member.name: M:MSharp.StringFormElement.ItemCssClass(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field, you can set a css class for this item.
Tips:
- css classes should always be lower case.
- Use "-" to separate the words in the css class.
- Use " " to separate multiple css classes.
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When an special appearance style is needed for the item.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
test-item
short-item test-item
c#: (Case != null) ? "case-item" : ""

member.name: M:MSharp.StringFormElement.Mandatory(System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary:
This attribute allows to make a form element mandatory or optional. This attribute overrides behaviour set in Modal.
Note:
If you change a form element which was marked as mandatory in Modal to optional by setting this attribute to False. Then the element will not be validated on client side but server side validation will take place as set.
======== AS SET IN MODAL AT THE TIME OF CREATING PROPERTY
TODO: Describe...
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need to make a form element mandatory on UI.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
You have an option comment field but want to make it mandatory for a specific form

member.name: M:MSharp.StringFormElement.CustomInitializer(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field, you can specify a C# expression to initialize the input control. The expression specified here will be used to populate input control on page load.
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
In scenarios when you need to initialize the input control especially custom control added on the form.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
You want to load Categories for a custom added dropdown list
lstCategories.DataSource = Categories;

member.name: M:MSharp.StringFormElement.LabelCssClass(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field, you can set a css class for this label.
Tips:
- css classes should always be lower case.
- Use "-" to separate the words in the css class.
- Use " " to separate multiple css classes.

======== EXAMPLES ===============================
test-label
short-label test-label
c#: (Case != null) ? "case-label" : ""

member.name: M:MSharp.StringFormElement.ControlWrapperCssClass(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field, you can enter a custom css class for the wrapper of the input control.
Tips:
- css classes should always be lower case.
- Use "-" to separate the words in the css class.
- Use " " to separate multiple css classes.

leftside
add-user-wrapper
c#: (Case != null) ? "case-user-wrapper" : ""

member.name: M:MSharp.StringFormElement.CustomDataLoad(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field you can write a custom c# code which loads the element before data entry.

txtCaseCount = App.Context.User.Cases.Count();

member.name: M:MSharp.StringFormElement.AutoFocus(System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary:
This attribute allows to to specify the auto focus behaviour of the input control
Often on lengthy pages if form is below the browser normal window and control focus causes unnecessary page scroll to show the default focused element you can use this property to set the
AutoFocus to False. which will prevent page to scroll on load
======== DEFAULT ================================
First element of the form receives the focus when the page is loaded.
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need to alter the control Auto focus

True

member.name: M:MSharp.ChartSerie.AxisTextExpression(System.String)
member.summary:
A c# expression which returns a string value for the x-axis label of the data point.

(item.NumberOfComments / TotalComments ) * 100 + "%"

It is a mandatory property

item.CalculateValue()
item.NumberofNewFeeds

member.name: M:MSharp.ChartSerie.LabelExpression(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field you can specify c# Expression to specify a string type value for the text of each data point in the plot. This will override the axis text expression attribute

- use "item" to reference each element in the DataSource sequence
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
Use this to display text for data point label in the plot
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
item.DayOfWeek
(item.Sales / 1000).Round(0) + "K"

item.Name

member.name: M:MSharp.ListButton`1.HeaderTemplate(System.String)
member.summary:
The markup to appear in the header template of the button element in the list.
List elements including button and custom elements are placed inside tag of the grid view control.
Markup / Template specified in this field will be places in of the respective tag
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you want to add a custom markup for the footer of the element in the list.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
Static Text
======== HEADING ================================
C# Expression
[*Name*]

member.name: M:MSharp.ListButton`1.RepeatDataSource(System.String)
member.summary:
This is a C# expression field. In this field you can specify a collection type data source.
If the data source is specified, M# generates an asp.net "Repeater Control" with the specified "DataSource" and placed the button as the "ItemTemplate" of the "Repeater Control"
Tip:
- You can access each public property / method of each element of the data source sequence in other attributes of the same button e.g. Image URL, Text etc.
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
This attribute is very useful when you want to render multiple button based on a DataSource e.g. List of users to link their profiles or Products of a category
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
You want to render buttons for all the active users with FullName as the button text
Repeat data source: Item.GetActiveEmployees()
Text: C#: (Container.DataItem as Employee).FullName
You want to render buttons for a category products with thumbnail images and link to the View Page
Repeat data source: Item.Products
Image URL: C#: (Container.DataItem as Product).Photo.Url()
Query String: C#: (Container.DataItem as Product).ID

member.name: M:MSharp.ListButton`1.Text(System.String)
member.summary:
You should enter the display text of the button in this field.
Supported formats:
- Plain text
- c# expression
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
To set the display text of the button.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
Add user
c#: string.Format("Add {0}th user", App.Context.Users.Count() + 1)

member.name: M:MSharp.ListButton`1.ExcelTemplate(System.String)
member.summary:
Specifies an alternative output format when this field is exported to Excel.
By default every field is exported to Excel as it is displayed on the screen.
This field allows you to use an alternative format for the Excel file.
======== DEFAULT ================================
By default the Excel format of a field is the same as the format of the field itself.
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
Use this when you one to specify a different format string for the field when it's formatted to Excel.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
"{0:d}".FormatWith(Item.CreatedDate)
Using a custom date format
"Unexportable"
A literal string

member.name: M:MSharp.ListButton`1.CausesValidation(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
If set to True, the Validation will be performed on the module when the button is clicked.
======== DEFAULT ================================
True (Except Cancel Button which is generated at the time of creating a module)
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you don't want to perform validation on button click.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
For cancel button which you don't want to validate the page and just leave it.

member.name: M:MSharp.ListButton`1.DisplayMode(MSharp.DisplayMode)
member.summary:
This property sets the visibility options of a column in a list module. If at least one column in a list has a display mode value other than default, then it would become possible for the users to select the columns they would like to see in the list.
There are four possible options for this attribute:
1. Always: means this column must be always visible and users can not hide it
2. Default: the default behaviour means it will be visible, but users can hide it
3. Selectable: means this column will be initially hidden, but users can make it visible
4. Hidden: means this column will be hidden and users will not be able to make it visible.
======== DEFAULT ================================
"Default" means it will be visible, but users can hide/unhide it.
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
If you set the Display mode of one single columns, you will change the behaviour of the whole module.
Use this field when you have too many columns in a list view and want to make the visibility of some of the columns optional.

member.name: M:MSharp.ListButton`1.IsDefault(System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary:
If Set to True, the button is made the default button on the page which is triggered when the return key is pressed.
Note:
You can only have one button as the default button in a module.
When a button is set as Default button using this attribute then this attribute is set as False for all the other buttons
======== DEFAULT ================================
False (Except Save button which is generated at the time of creating a Form Module )
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you want to set the button as the default focused button.

member.summary:

member.name: M:MSharp.ListButton`1.ConfirmQuestion(System.String)
member.summary:
If you enter a text in this field, the system will show a confirmation message to the end user when they click this button.
If the user then selects No, the operation will be terminated and the button workflow will not run.
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================

It's used mostly in Delete operations or any other sensitive action.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================

member.summary:
In this field, you can apply css classes for this button's element column in the list.
The list is generated as HTML Table element and this class is applied to the "td" tag of the respective element
Tips:

- Use " " to separate multiple css classes.

add-button add-user-button

member.name: M:MSharp.ListButton`1.SortingStatement(System.String)
member.summary:
Use this field if you can specify a sort statement (C# expression )for this element other than the default sort statement.
This sorting statement is executed when you click on the button column header for ASC or DESC sort
Tips:
- Use "|" to separate multiple sort expressions.
- Sort key attribute must be defined in order to enable sorting
======== DEFAULT ================================
By default, the items in the List Module will be sorted based on the the default sort order of the Type.
i.e. Either by an explicitly defined SortOrder on that Type, or the ToString() of the object.
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you want the items in the list to be sorted differently from the default setting of the type based on this element.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
item.LastName DESC
item.Order
item.Name | Item.Email

member.summary:

member.name: M:MSharp.ListModule`1.SourceEvaluationCriteria(System.String)
member.summary:
Sometimes the DataSource of a module can only be evaluated in a special condition or otherwise it will throw an exception.
You can write such condition here, so that if your specified criteria is not met, then the DataSource expression is not even evaluated.
======== EXAMPLE ================================
Category != null
Let's say your DataSource is Category.Items, while sometimes Category can be null. In that case the DataSource would throw an exception if you didn't have this SourceEvaluationCriteria.

- List: A ListView control will be generated to display data

member.name: M:MSharp.ListModule`1.SortingStatement(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field you can specify the sort expression for the list.
Supported formats:
-
Property name
- Any C# expression using "item" object.
Tips:
- Use "|" to separate multiple sort expressions.
-
You can add " DESC" to the end of each phrase to specify descending sort.
======== DEFAULT ================================
By default items in the List Module will be sorted based on the the default sort order of the Type.
That is, either by an explicitly defined SortOrder on that Type, or the ToString() of the object.
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you want the items in the list to be sorted differently from the default setting of the type.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
LastName
item.LastName
item.GetLastName()
item.LastName + ", " + item.FirstName
LastName DESC | item.GetSomething()
FirstName DESC | LastName | MyModuleMethod(item) DESC

member.name: M:MSharp.ListModule`1.ItemsHeader(System.String)
member.summary:
In this attribute, you can specify custom markup which is displayed just above the gird header
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================

======== EXAMPLES ===============================
You can display referenced element e.g menus, Forms, or event just textual description

member.name: M:MSharp.ListModule`1.StartUpBehaviour(MSharp.OnStart)
member.summary:
In this attribute you can select the preferred start up behaviour of the list. This affects how the result set will be loaded for the first time.
Load List: List will be populated based on the specified DataSource
Auto Search: List will be populated based on the specified DataSource but the DataSource will be filtered based on the search elements default set values
Wait for Search: List will not be populated unless a postback happens on the page
======== DEFAULT ================================
Load List
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
It is a very useful attribute in situation where you have pre-set search elements and want to display results based on the search elements pre-set selected values
Or, You want the user to get the results based on the search criteria.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
You display product catalogue with options to filter products. You need to display products based on the default set filters e.g. Most Reviewed, Most Rated etc.
In this case you can use Auto Search option to automatically filter result set initially
You need to display a batch of payment which needs to be verified at the month end which has huge number of records. Showing all the results could take longer to bind data grid.
In this case you can use Wait for search to display only the records which need to be managed by thier status

On a list module.
