member.name: M:MSharp.ListModule`1.ListContainerCssClasses(System.String)
member.summary:
A comma separated list of css classes which will be rendered as nested container spans around the list control.
Tips:
- css classes should always be lower case.
- Use "-" to separate the words in the css class.
- Use " " to separate multiple css classes.
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you want to wrap your list control with a span with the specified class(es) to be able to apply a special appearance style.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
list-container
left-section list-container
c#: (Case != null) ? "case-users-container" : ""

member.name: M:MSharp.ListModule`1.ControllerInterfaces(System.String)
member.summary:
The interfaces that this user control (module) should implement.
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
This is particularly useful when using ICallbackEventHandler interface for AJAX call backs.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
"ICallbackEventHandler, IAnotherInterface"

member.name: M:MSharp.ListModule`1.MarkupWrapper(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field you can specify a wrapper template for the module.
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When want to customize the appearance of the module by adding extra markup around it.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
[#MODULE#]

member.name: M:MSharp.ListModule`1.Sortable(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
If set to False, columns sorting option will be disabled and a simple text header will be generated for the list
======== DEFAULT ================================
True
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you don't want sorting to be enabled on the header of a list especially when customized sorting formula is applied on result set
or result set contains huge number of elements.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
You need to display customized list based on fixed sorting formula and don't want to allow users to sort the result set.
You need to display large dataset and want to disable sorting on UI to restrict post back

member.name: M:MSharp.ListModule`1.ShowHeaderRow(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
If Set to False, Header row of the GridView will not be shown
======== DEFAULT ================================
False
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you don't want a hander row to be generated on the list.

member.name: M:MSharp.ListModule`1.ShowFooterRow(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
If set to True, a footer of the GridView will be shown
======== DEFAULT ================================
False
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you want a footer row to be generated on the list.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
When you need a footer row to show the SUM calculation of some numbers in the table.

member.name: M:MSharp.ListModule`1.SelectCheckbox(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
If set to true, a server side checkbox will be generated for each row to select individual row and one in the header row to select all the rows.
Tips:
- Call "GetSelectedItems()" method to get all the rows selected in backend
======== DEFAULT ================================
False
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need to implement row selection in a list
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
You are displaying email messages and want to enable message selection for moving, archiving or deletion purpose

member.name: M:MSharp.ListModule`1.RootCssClass(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field you can enter the css class of the module.
Tips:
- css classes should always be lower case.
- Use "-" to separate the words in the css class.
- Use " " to separate multiple css classes.
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need to apply some css to the module.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
twtwo-column-form
compact-view user-order-view
c#: (Case != null) ? "progress-list" : ""

member.name: M:MSharp.ListModule`1.PageSize(System.String)
member.summary:
In this attribute you can specify a numeric value for the page size. This will be the number of records shown on each page of the list
======== DEFAULT ================================
10
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you have large number of records and want to display them in chunks using grid view paging.
This helps making records view more compact rather than displaying infinite scroll bar
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
15
20

member.name: M:MSharp.ListModulePager.Label(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field you can specify a manning full label for the list page which is displayed on the left of the pager control
======== DEFAULT ================================
Results per page:
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need to change it according to the design specifications
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
Records per page:

member.name: M:MSharp.ListModulePager.Position(MSharp.PagerAt)
member.summary:
This attributes let's you choose the position of the paging options .
Top: Pager is displayed above list header
Bottom: Pager is displayed below the list
Top & bottom: Pager is displayed both top and at bottom
======== DEFAULT ================================
Bottom
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need to display the pager at a different position on the list

member.name: M:MSharp.ListModulePager.AutoPostBack(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
If set to False, the pager control will not perform a postback on changing the page size.
======== DEFAULT ================================
True
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you don't want pager control to automatically postback and update the list records and need to implement custom postback control and

member.name: M:MSharp.ListModulePager.Key(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field you can specify a unique key for pager control. This key is prefixed with "lstPageSize" string to make the ID of the pager
======== DEFAULT ================================
MainPager
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need to define more than one pager on one list
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
TopPager
SidePager

member.name: M:MSharp.ListModulePager.OptionTextFormat(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field you can specify a format for the text display for each paging option
Tips:
- You must use {0} keyword to format each paging option
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need to customize the text of each paging option
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
You want to display text along each paging option i.e. Display 5 Item
Display {0} Items
Want to display custom text
{0} Items per page

member.name: M:MSharp.ListModulePager.WrapperCssClass(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field, you can set a css class for this pager.
Tips:
- css classes should always be lower case.
- Use "-" to separate the words in the css class.
- Use " " to separate multiple css classes.
======== DEFAULT ================================
By default the element will have a css class of "item".
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When an special appearance style is needed for the pager.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
add-user-button
add-button add-user-button

member.name: M:MSharp.ListModulePager.Options(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field you can specify paging options each on a new line. These paging options are displayed on the UI. You must enter numeric value.
======== DEFAULT ================================
5
10
20
50
100
200
500
All
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need to customise the paging size options
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
5
15

member.name: M:MSharp.ListModulePager.ResetsToFirstPage(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
If set to False, pager will not be reset to the first page and the pager index will remain at the position it was before changing the page size
======== DEFAULT ================================
True
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you don't want to reset the selected page index. The records per page will be changed but the pager index will remain same.

member.name: M:MSharp.ListModulePager.NoLabel
member.summary: Sets the label of this element to be [#EMPTY#] which means no text should be generated.

member.name: M:MSharp.PropertyFilterElement`1.MemoryFilterCode(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field you can specify any dynamic logic scenario using C# expression. You must using "result" object to specify any lambda or custom expression
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need to apply complex filter expression.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
Example 1
result = results.Where(x=> x.Products.Any());
Example 2
result = results.Where(x=> txtPostCode.Text.HasValue() && x.Address.PostCode = txtPostcode.Text.Trim());

member.name: M:MSharp.PropertyFilterElement`1.WatermarkText(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field you can specify contents which appear on the input control as watermark text
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
Usually when you want to display a help text or any contents to inform user about something
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
Please enter email address ere
Postcode with without space e.g. AB12CD

member.name: M:MSharp.PropertyFilterElement`1.ReloadOnChange(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
If set to True, the element will perform a postback for the configured postback events
======== DEFAULT ================================
False
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need to perform server side execution whenever the value of the element is changed without clicking "Search" button explicitly. Especially to filet the list or other filter elements
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
You have a search filter on category and sub category to filter a list of products. You can enable AutoPostBack of Category filter element to populate the Sub Categories in order to filter products eventually

member.name: M:MSharp.PropertyFilterElement`1.DatabaseFilterCode(System.String)
M:MSharp.PropertyFilterElement`1.Control(MSharp.ControlType)
member.summary:
In this field you can choose the type of control for the filter element
======== DEFAULT ================================
Based on filter type
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need to display a different control for filter element then the default
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
You display category filter element which is by default a dropdown list but you want to change it to display an AutoComplete to enable user to select by typing in.

member.name: M:MSharp.PropertyFilterElement`1.AfterInput(System.String)
member.summary:
You can specify static contents or a C# expression which will be rendered just after the input control of this search filter.
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need customise the filter control by adding contents after input control.
You can also use this attribute to place module buttons.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
You want to display help text using custom html markup and static text and JQuery
Please enter email address you want to search
Placing the search Button
[#BUTTONS(Search)#]

member.name: M:MSharp.PropertyFilterElement`1.DefaultValueExpression(System.String)
member.summary:
in this field you can specify the default select value using C# expression
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need to set a default selected value for filter element.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
You are filtering phrase by language and set the default language to show default phrase at first
You have filter range on location search and want to set a default range to display the location at first

member.name: M:MSharp.PropertyFilterElement`1.Label(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field you can specify static text or C# expression for label of the input control.
Tips:
- use keyword [#EMPTY#], if you don't want to display the label
======== DEFAULT ================================
Property Name
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you want to customise the Label associated to filter element
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
Don't display label
[#EMPTY#]
Static Text
Email:

member.name: M:MSharp.PropertyFilterElement`1.DefaultFunction(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field you can specify the filter function for the element. You can supply one of the following
- Is
- IsNot
- NUll
- NotNUll
- Contains
- NotConstains
- BeginsWith
- EndWith
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need to override the default filter function of an element
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
You have a string filter element which by default implements contains filter functions but you wan to use "IS"

member.name: M:MSharp.PropertyFilterElement`1.ExtraControlAttributes(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field you can specify pre-defined or custom attributes for input control of this filter element.
Notes:
- Use this only for values that cannot be set through the M# interface.
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need to customize input control markup with additional attributes not available in M#
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
OnSelectedIndexChanged="control_SelectedIndexChanged"
EnableViewState="False"

member.name: M:MSharp.PropertyFilterElement`1.DataSource(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field you can provide the DataSource for collection type filter elements. This attribute is ignored for single value type element e.g. TextBox
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need to provide custom DataSource for the filter element
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
Categories.SubCategires
Enumerable.Range(0,10)

member.name: M:MSharp.PropertyFilterElement`1.ValueChangedHandler(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field you can specify a C# expression to handle the change event of a filter element
Tips:
- Make sure the Post back attribute is set to True
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need to perform custom logic on change event of a filter element
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
Loading products when category is changed
lstProducts.Datasource = lstCategory.GetSelected ().Products;

member.name: M:MSharp.PropertyFilterElement`1.SourceCriteria(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field you can specify a criteria which act as a where clause for the SataSource of the filter element.
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you want to filter the DataSource of the filter element base on some criteria.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
The generated code will be: Where(each=> each.Language == Language.English) .
each .Language == Language.English

member.name: M:MSharp.PropertyFilterElement`1.RowCssClass(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field, you can set a css class for this filter element.
Tips:
- css classes should always be lower case.
- Use "-" to separate the words in the css class.
- Use " " to separate multiple css classes.
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When a special appearance style is needed for the filter element..
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
narrow-item
narrow-item long-item
c#: (Case != null) ? "selected-item" : ""

member.name: M:MSharp.PropertyFilterElement`1.Box(MSharp.ModuleBox)
member.summary:
In this field you can select a box available in search section. On selecting a box, the filter element will be placed inside that box
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need to fulfil custom design or want to group related search elements

member.name: M:MSharp.PropertyFilterElement`1.DisplayExpression(System.String)
member.summary:
The expression to use for each item to display the text in the dropdown list
======== DEFAULT ================================
ToString() expression of each instance
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you want to display a custom text expression especially with combination of properties
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
item.Firstname + " " + item.Lastname
item.Name + " (" + item.Code + " )"

member.name: M:MSharp.PropertyFilterElement`1.NoLabel
member.summary: Sets the label of this element to be [#EMPTY#] which means no text should be generated.

member.name: M:MSharp.Association`1.OnDelete(MSharp.CascadeAction)
member.summary:
You can use this property to select delete behaviour of an instance of this entity type.
======== DEFAULT ================================
Throw Warning
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you want to allow cascade delete or custom delete behaviour
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
A One to Many association between Order and OrderItems and want to delete all products when an Order is deleted, Use Cascade Delete
A One to Many association between Category and Products and want to restrict deleting a category if is has products, Use Throw Warning

member.name: M:MSharp.Association`1.Name(System.String)
member.summary:
In this Property you specify the name of the property which is generated in Modal to access this property.
Note:
- Specify unique name in the entity
- Specify name in Camel case e.g. ResidenceAddress, ProductBatch, IsAllowed etc.
======== DEFAULT ================================
It is inferred from the title of the property
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
It is a mandatory property
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
ResidenceAddress
IsAllowed

member.name: M:MSharp.Association`1.ReferencedType(System.String)
member.summary:
This attribute lets you select the required entity type to create an association.
======== DEFAULT ================================
The entity type selected at the time of creating association
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
Use this property to change the association entity type
Note:
- M# doesn't allow to change the reference type if an inverse association exists
- Changing reference type could cause data corruption

member.name: M:MSharp.Association`1.Mandatory(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
If set to True, a required validation rule will be generated in Modal and a required field validation control will be generated on UI to require the input.
This behaviour can be overridden in UI using same attribute of form element. But, if the property is marked as mandatory the rule will be applied in modal even if it is set to false in UI
======== DEFAULT ================================
False
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need to make a field mandatory for an entity instance

member.name: M:MSharp.Association`1.MinCardinality(System.Int32)
member.summary:
You can use this attribute to enforce the lower limit of cardinality on an association. M# will enforce the minimum numbers of relational records on Form module.
Note:
- Specifying 0 as minimum cardinality will make the association optional
- Specifying a value more than 0 will make the association mandatory and M# will generate validation message to require minimum cardinality
======== DEFAULT ================================
0
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
This attribute is useful when imposing minimum number of association relational records required at the time of saving

member.name: M:MSharp.Association`1.Title(System.String)
member.summary:
In this Property you specify the title of the property which is generated as the label in the module
Note:
- Specify unique name in the entity
- Specify name in normal case e.g. Residence address, Product batch, Is allowed? etc.
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
It is a mandatory property
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
Residence address
Is allowed?

member.name: M:MSharp.Association`1.MaxCardinality(System.Nullable{System.Int32})
member.summary:
You can use this attribute to enforce the upper limit of cardinality. M# will restrict the maximum numbers of relational record on Form module.
Note:
Specifying bigger number will slow down the page rendering because UI form elements for relational data of One-to-Many associations are generated based on the number specified here.
e.g. if you specify 100 for this value M# will render 100 rows of input controls to add relational data on Form Element.
======== DEFAULT ================================
10
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
Use this attribute to limit the number of maximum relational records added for this association. This is useful to enforce data input restriction for underlying association.

member.name: M:MSharp.Association`1.Unique(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
If set to True, a unique validation rule for this property will generated in the Modal which will prevent duplicate values.
Also, a static method will be generated which finds and retunes an instance from the database by the property's value
The method name is inferred from the property name. e.g Marking a property "Email" as unique will generate a method "FindByEmail"
======== DEFAULT ================================
False
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
Use this attribute when you want to make a property value unique
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
Email Address
Telephone Numbers
User IDs

member.name: M:MSharp.Association`1.LazyLoad(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
If set to "True" the association is loaded lazily i.e. on demand and cached afterwards
======== DEFAULT ================================
False
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
This attribute is useful when boosting performance

member.name: M:MSharp.Association`1.Notes(System.String)
member.summary: A description for the property to document any notes. Make your descriptions as descriptive as possible as they will be helpful later on to understand the Business Logic.

member.name: M:MSharp.Association`1.Attributes(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field you can specify custom C# attribute(s) for the property.
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need to apply custom C# attributes on the property.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
[Serializable]
[XmlIgnore]

member.name: M:MSharp.Association`1.XmlIgnore(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
When set to True, the property will not be serialized when xml serialization will be performed on the instance
======== DEFAULT ================================
False
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need to perform XML serialization and When you want to omit the property value

member.name: M:MSharp.Association`1.Override(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
If set to true, Override keyword will be generated for the property
======== DEFAULT ================================
False
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you have defined a virtual property in the base class and want to override the property in the derived class

member.name: M:MSharp.Association`1.Virtual(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
If set to True, "Virtual" keyword will be generated in the property definition
======== DEFAULT ================================
False
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you are defining a base class and want to override this property in derived classes

member.name: M:MSharp.Association`1.RequiredValidationMessage(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field you can specify a message which is displayed when the property value is null
======== DEFAULT ================================
Inferred form the property name
e.g. Please provide a value for Email
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need to display a dynamic validation message which requires business logic.

member.name: M:MSharp.Association`1.DatabaseIndex(System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary:
If set to True, database index is generated for the property. Index are created to boost up the speed of data retrieval but downgrades the data writing speed if used unnecessary.
======== DEFAULT ================================
False
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When the property is going to be used rigorously to retrieve data from the database.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
Unique fields which are going to be parameterised often in data retrieval
Identity Fields

member.name: M:MSharp.Association`1.Calculated(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
If set to True, the property is only generated in Modal entity class and no respective column is generated in database table
======== DEFAULT ================================
False
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need to generate calculated properties especially when you need to display the value on UI
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
You have FirstName and LastName as separate properties and want to create a property FullName which retunes the concatenation of both the FirstName and LastName Properties
You want to show Customer balance which required calculation you can implement a private method to calculate the balance and call that in calculated property to display it on UI

member.name: M:MSharp.Association`1.Documentation(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field you can specify contents which are generated in the documentation summary tag of the poetry
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
It is good practice to provide documentation of properties to make it more useable for consumer of the property or the developer who are going to manipulate it later on.

member.name: M:MSharp.Association`1.HelpText(System.String)
member.summary:
In this property you can specify contends which are displayed as the help text for the property.
This property is also available in form module
======== S WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ============
When you need to display a dynamic help text property which requires Business Logic.
Use Form Module element attribute "help text " to specify static help text with html markup.

member.name: M:MSharp.Association`1.Getter(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field you can specify a C# expression to implement the get accessory of a calculated property
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you have a calculated property and want to implement custom get accessor
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
CalculateBalance()
FirstName + " " + LastName

member.name: M:MSharp.Association`1.Default(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field you can specify a static or c# expression based value which is set as the default value of the property in entity class constructor
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you want to specify a default vale for a property
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
You have a DateTime field DateCreated
LocalTime.Now
You have a field DicountCode which you want auto generate
GenerateDiscountCode()

member.name: M:MSharp.Association`1.DefaultFormatString(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field you can specify the string format for a property which will be used to format the string on UI.
======== S WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ============
It is useful in cases of specifying a default format for DateTime and Numeric value to be printed on the screen using a default format string.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
You have DateTime property DateCreated which you want to show only short date on UI
d
You have DateTime property DateCreated which you want to show custom date format
dd/MMM/yyyy
You have Numeric field and want to add leading zeros if the value is less than 4 digits
D4

member.name: M:MSharp.Association`1.IsReadOnlyInterfaceProperty(System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary:
If set to True, only the get accessor will be generated.
======== DEFAULT ================================
False
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
This is useful in scenarios when you want to have field which needs to be initialized at runtime time which should not be changed.
Although, Constant variables are used as well but they cannot have dynamic value or initialized at runtime

member.name: M:MSharp.BinaryProperty.OptimizationQuality(System.Nullable{System.Int32})
member.summary:
This attribute works with image files. In this field you can specify optimization quality of an image from 0 to 100.
======== DEFAULT ================================
70
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you want to adjust the quality of the image file in order to make it compact

member.name: M:MSharp.BinaryProperty.Name(System.String)
member.summary:
In this Property you specify the name of the property which is generated in Modal to access this property.
Note:
- Specify unique name in the entity
- Specify name in Camel case e.g. ResidenceAddress, ProductBatch, IsAllowed etc.
======== DEFAULT ================================
It is inferred from the title of the property
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
It is a mandatory property
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
ResidenceAddress
IsAllowed

member.name: M:MSharp.BinaryProperty.IsImage(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
When set to True, the binary file is treated as an image file and optimization is performed if configured.
======== DEFAULT ================================
False
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you want to manipulate binary files as image files.

member.name: M:MSharp.BinaryProperty.Mandatory(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
If set to True, a required validation rule will be generated in Modal and a required field validation control will be generated on UI to require the input.
This behaviour can be overridden in UI using same attribute of form element. But, if the property is marked as mandatory the rule will be applied in modal even if it is set to false in UI
======== DEFAULT ================================
False
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need to make a field mandatory for an entity instance

member.name: M:MSharp.BinaryProperty.AutoOptimize(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
This field only works with the image files. when set to true, images are optimized based on the default settings.
======== DEFAULT ================================
False
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you want to optimize image using default settings The images quality set as 70%

member.name: M:MSharp.BinaryProperty.ValidExtensions(System.String)
member.summary:
In this attribute, you can specify file extension which are validated at the time of uploading. You can specify comma spirited static or C# expression string.
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you want to restrict the allowed files extension
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
Example 1
".pdf", ".xsl",".txt"
Example 2
Config.Get("Allowed.Extensions")

member.name: M:MSharp.BinaryProperty.Title(System.String)
member.summary:
In this Property you specify the title of the property which is generated as the label in the module
Note:
- Specify unique name in the entity
- Specify name in normal case e.g. Residence address, Product batch, Is allowed? etc.
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
It is a mandatory property
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
Residence address
Is allowed?

member.name: M:MSharp.BinaryProperty.Width(System.Nullable{System.Int32})
member.summary:
This attribute works only on image files. In this attribute you can specify a numeric value to optimize the width of the original image
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When image optimization is required on the width of the original image

member.name: M:MSharp.BinaryProperty.Height(System.Nullable{System.Int32})
member.summary:
This attribute only works with IsImage attribute. In this field you can specify any numeric value for image height which is used during image optimization
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you want to change the height of the original image during optimization e.g when generating thumbnail images, to adjust profile images etc.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
Example 1
250
Example 2
300

member.name: M:MSharp.BinaryProperty.Unique(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
If set to True, a unique validation rule for this property will generated in the Modal which will prevent duplicate values.
Also, a static method will be generated which finds and retunes an instance from the database by the property's value
The method name is inferred from the property name. e.g Marking a property "Email" as unique will generate a method "FindByEmail"
======== DEFAULT ================================
False
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
Use this attribute when you want to make a property value unique
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
Email Address
Telephone Numbers
User IDs

member.name: M:MSharp.BinaryProperty.DefaultValueUrl(System.String)
member.summary:
This attribute works IsImage attribute. In this field you can display the default image URL which is displayed when no image is available
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you want to display a default image when no image available e.g. profile Images
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
Example 1
Images/profile/no-image.png

member.name: M:MSharp.BinaryProperty.SecureAccess(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
When set to True, the files are uploaded to a secure folder and are displayed using secure link. For more information pleas read tutorial File Security
======== DEFAULT ================================
False
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you want implement secure access on files

member.name: M:MSharp.BinaryProperty.Notes(System.String)
member.summary: A description for the property to document any notes. Make your descriptions as descriptive as possible as they will be helpful later on to understand the Business Logic.

member.name: M:MSharp.BinaryProperty.PreserveTransparency(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
This attribute works only with image files. When set to True, transparency of the png and gif files are maintained during optimization
======== DEFAULT ================================
False
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you want to preserve the transparency of images

member.name: M:MSharp.BinaryProperty.Attributes(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field you can specify custom C# attribute(s) for the property.
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need to apply custom C# attributes on the property.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
[Serializable]
[XmlIgnore]

member.name: M:MSharp.BinaryProperty.XmlIgnore(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
When set to True, the property will not be serialized when xml serialization will be performed on the instance
======== DEFAULT ================================
False
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need to perform XML serialization and When you want to omit the property value

member.name: M:MSharp.BinaryProperty.Override(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
If set to true, Override keyword will be generated for the property
======== DEFAULT ================================
False
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you have defined a virtual property in the base class and want to override the property in the derived class

member.name: M:MSharp.BinaryProperty.Virtual(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
If set to True, "Virtual" keyword will be generated in the property definition
======== DEFAULT ================================
False
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you are defining a base class and want to override this property in derived classes

member.name: M:MSharp.BinaryProperty.RequiredValidationMessage(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field you can specify a message which is displayed when the property value is null
======== DEFAULT ================================
Inferred form the property name
e.g. Please provide a value for Email
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need to display a dynamic validation message which requires business logic.

member.name: M:MSharp.BinaryProperty.DatabaseIndex(System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary:
If set to True, database index is generated for the property. Index are created to boost up the speed of data retrieval but downgrades the data writing speed if used unnecessary.
======== DEFAULT ================================
False
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When the property is going to be used rigorously to retrieve data from the database.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
Unique fields which are going to be parameterised often in data retrieval
Identity Fields

member.name: M:MSharp.BinaryProperty.Calculated(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
If set to True, the property is only generated in Modal entity class and no respective column is generated in database table
======== DEFAULT ================================
False
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need to generate calculated properties especially when you need to display the value on UI
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
You have FirstName and LastName as separate properties and want to create a property FullName which retunes the concatenation of both the FirstName and LastName Properties
You want to show Customer balance which required calculation you can implement a private method to calculate the balance and call that in calculated property to display it on UI

member.name: M:MSharp.BinaryProperty.Documentation(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field you can specify contents which are generated in the documentation summary tag of the poetry
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
It is good practice to provide documentation of properties to make it more useable for consumer of the property or the developer who are going to manipulate it later on.

member.name: M:MSharp.BinaryProperty.HelpText(System.String)
member.summary:
In this property you can specify contends which are displayed as the help text for the property.
This property is also available in form module
======== S WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ============
When you need to display a dynamic help text property which requires Business Logic.
Use Form Module element attribute "help text " to specify static help text with html markup.

member.name: M:MSharp.BinaryProperty.Getter(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field you can specify a C# expression to implement the get accessory of a calculated property
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you have a calculated property and want to implement custom get accessor
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
CalculateBalance()
FirstName + " " + LastName

member.name: M:MSharp.BinaryProperty.Default(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field you can specify a static or c# expression based value which is set as the default value of the property in entity class constructor
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you want to specify a default vale for a property
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
You have a DateTime field DateCreated
LocalTime.Now
You have a field DicountCode which you want auto generate
GenerateDiscountCode()

member.name: M:MSharp.BinaryProperty.DefaultFormatString(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field you can specify the string format for a property which will be used to format the string on UI.
======== S WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ============
It is useful in cases of specifying a default format for DateTime and Numeric value to be printed on the screen using a default format string.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
You have DateTime property DateCreated which you want to show only short date on UI
d
You have DateTime property DateCreated which you want to show custom date format
dd/MMM/yyyy
You have Numeric field and want to add leading zeros if the value is less than 4 digits
D4

member.name: M:MSharp.BinaryProperty.IsReadOnlyInterfaceProperty(System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary:
If set to True, only the get accessor will be generated.
======== DEFAULT ================================
False
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
This is useful in scenarios when you want to have field which needs to be initialized at runtime time which should not be changed.
Although, Constant variables are used as well but they cannot have dynamic value or initialized at runtime

member.name: M:MSharp.BooleanProperty.TrueText(System.String)
member.summary:
In this attribute you can specify a text for the "True" state of a Boolean element. When the Form is loaded for this type the text is displayed beside the input control
Note:
M# displays a checkbox input control by default for bool properties. But, when the value for this attribute is specified then a radio button input control is rendered with the specified text.
======== DEFAULT ================================
Yes
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you want to show a radio button with the text for "True" state of a bool value

member.name: M:MSharp.BooleanProperty.Name(System.String)
member.summary:
In this Property you specify the name of the property which is generated in Modal to access this property.
Note:
- Specify unique name in the entity
- Specify name in Camel case e.g. ResidenceAddress, ProductBatch, IsAllowed etc.
======== DEFAULT ================================
It is inferred from the title of the property
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
It is a mandatory property
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
ResidenceAddress
IsAllowed

member.name: M:MSharp.BooleanProperty.FalseText(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field you can specify a text for the "False" state of the Boolean element.
Note:
M# displays a checkbox input control by default for bool properties. But, when the value for this attribute is specified then a radio button input control is rendered with the specified text.
======== DEFAULT ================================
No
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you want to display a radio button input control with custom text on "False" State of bool element

member.name: M:MSharp.BooleanProperty.Mandatory(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
If set to True, a required validation rule will be generated in Modal and a required field validation control will be generated on UI to require the input.
This behaviour can be overridden in UI using same attribute of form element. But, if the property is marked as mandatory the rule will be applied in modal even if it is set to false in UI
======== DEFAULT ================================
False
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need to make a field mandatory for an entity instance

member.name: M:MSharp.BooleanProperty.NullText(System.String)
member.summary:
This attribute works will nullable bool type. You can specify a text for the UNKNOWN state of the element.
Note:
M# displays a checkbox input control by default for nullable bool properties. But, when the value for this attribute is specified then a dropdown list is rendered with the specified text.
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you want textual representation of a nullable bool element when the state is null / unknown

member.name: M:MSharp.BooleanProperty.Title(System.String)
member.summary:
In this Property you specify the title of the property which is generated as the label in the module
Note:
- Specify unique name in the entity
- Specify name in normal case e.g. Residence address, Product batch, Is allowed? etc.
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
It is a mandatory property
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
Residence address
Is allowed?

member.name: M:MSharp.DateTimeProperty.UseUtcDatetimeFormat(System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary:
When set to True, System.DateTime value of the current object is Converted the to Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).
======== DEFAULT ================================
False
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
It is good to always store DateTime in UTC format for enterprise and globalized applications and display DateTime in local time zone.
Use UTC especially in forums where you record DateTime automatically e.g. DatePosted, DateReplied etc. The benefit is that the records always sorted correctly
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
You have a social website hosted on different servers in different zones and users around the world post contents using their local server.
In this scenario, you should store DateTime in UTC format. This will help in keeping message threads in correct date order even the Time zone is different.
But remember that you should always display dates in local time zone.

member.name: M:MSharp.DateTimeProperty.UpperBound(System.String)
member.summary:
In this attribute you can specify the maximum date system should accept.
M# will generate validation code which will throw a validation exception, if the DateTime entered is later than the DateTime specified in this attribute
Note:
You must specify a DateTime object
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you want to impose a maximum DateTime validation rule.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
new DateTime(2014,01,25)
LocalTime.Now.AddDays(6)

member.name: M:MSharp.DateTimeProperty.Mandatory(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
If set to True, a required validation rule will be generated in Modal and a required field validation control will be generated on UI to require the input.
This behaviour can be overridden in UI using same attribute of form element. But, if the property is marked as mandatory the rule will be applied in modal even if it is set to false in UI
======== DEFAULT ================================
False
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need to make a field mandatory for an entity instance

member.name: M:MSharp.DateTimeProperty.LowerBound(System.String)
member.summary:
In this attribute you can specify the minimum date system should accept.
M# will generate validation code which will throw a validation exception, if the DateTime entered is earlier than the DateTime specified in this attribute
Note:
You must specify a DateTime object
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you want to impose a minimum DateTime validation rule.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
new DateTime(2000,01,25)
LocalTime.Now.AddDays(6)

member.name: M:MSharp.DateTimeProperty.HasDate(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
If set to False, only Time part of the DateTime will be rendered for input and output controls
======== DEFAULT ================================
True (When DateTime type is Select)
False (When only Time type is Select)
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you don't want to manipulate enable / disable Date aspect of a DateTime field
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
When you want to handle Order reservation for limited time birth then Date doesn't matter

member.summary: A description for the property to document any notes. Make your descriptions as descriptive as possible as they will be helpful later on to understand the Business Logic.

member.name: M:MSharp.DateTimeProperty.Attributes(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field you can specify custom C# attribute(s) for the property.
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need to apply custom C# attributes on the property.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
[Serializable]
[XmlIgnore]

member.name: M:MSharp.DateTimeProperty.XmlIgnore(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
When set to True, the property will not be serialized when xml serialization will be performed on the instance
======== DEFAULT ================================
False
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need to perform XML serialization and When you want to omit the property value

member.name: M:MSharp.DateTimeProperty.Override(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
If set to true, Override keyword will be generated for the property
======== DEFAULT ================================
False
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you have defined a virtual property in the base class and want to override the property in the derived class

member.name: M:MSharp.DateTimeProperty.Virtual(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
If set to True, "Virtual" keyword will be generated in the property definition
======== DEFAULT ================================
False
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you are defining a base class and want to override this property in derived classes

member.name: M:MSharp.DateTimeProperty.RequiredValidationMessage(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field you can specify a message which is displayed when the property value is null
======== DEFAULT ================================
Inferred form the property name
e.g. Please provide a value for Email
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need to display a dynamic validation message which requires business logic.

member.name: M:MSharp.DateTimeProperty.DatabaseIndex(System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary:
If set to True, database index is generated for the property. Index are created to boost up the speed of data retrieval but downgrades the data writing speed if used unnecessary.
======== DEFAULT ================================
False
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When the property is going to be used rigorously to retrieve data from the database.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
Unique fields which are going to be parameterised often in data retrieval
Identity Fields

member.name: M:MSharp.DateTimeProperty.Calculated(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
If set to True, the property is only generated in Modal entity class and no respective column is generated in database table
======== DEFAULT ================================
False
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need to generate calculated properties especially when you need to display the value on UI
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
You have FirstName and LastName as separate properties and want to create a property FullName which retunes the concatenation of both the FirstName and LastName Properties
You want to show Customer balance which required calculation you can implement a private method to calculate the balance and call that in calculated property to display it on UI

member.name: M:MSharp.DateTimeProperty.Documentation(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field you can specify contents which are generated in the documentation summary tag of the poetry
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
It is good practice to provide documentation of properties to make it more useable for consumer of the property or the developer who are going to manipulate it later on.

member.name: M:MSharp.DateTimeProperty.HelpText(System.String)
member.summary:
In this property you can specify contends which are displayed as the help text for the property.
This property is also available in form module
======== S WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ============
When you need to display a dynamic help text property which requires Business Logic.
Use Form Module element attribute "help text " to specify static help text with html markup.

member.name: M:MSharp.DateTimeProperty.Getter(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field you can specify a C# expression to implement the get accessory of a calculated property
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you have a calculated property and want to implement custom get accessor
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
CalculateBalance()
FirstName + " " + LastName

member.name: M:MSharp.DateTimeProperty.Default(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field you can specify a static or c# expression based value which is set as the default value of the property in entity class constructor
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you want to specify a default vale for a property
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
You have a DateTime field DateCreated
LocalTime.Now
You have a field DicountCode which you want auto generate
GenerateDiscountCode()

member.name: M:MSharp.DateTimeProperty.DefaultFormatString(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field you can specify the string format for a property which will be used to format the string on UI.
======== S WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ============
It is useful in cases of specifying a default format for DateTime and Numeric value to be printed on the screen using a default format string.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
You have DateTime property DateCreated which you want to show only short date on UI
d
You have DateTime property DateCreated which you want to show custom date format
dd/MMM/yyyy
You have Numeric field and want to add leading zeros if the value is less than 4 digits
D4

member.name: M:MSharp.DateTimeProperty.IsReadOnlyInterfaceProperty(System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary:
If set to True, only the get accessor will be generated.
======== DEFAULT ================================
False
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
This is useful in scenarios when you want to have field which needs to be initialized at runtime time which should not be changed.
Although, Constant variables are used as well but they cannot have dynamic value or initialized at runtime

member.name: M:MSharp.EntityType.LogEvents(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
When set to False, no log will be generated in ApplicationEvents on saving or deleting the entity's instance
======== DEFAULT ================================
True
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you don't want to log events for entities hold insensitive data.
It is recommended not to disable it because it is very helpful in debugging.

member.name: M:MSharp.EntityType.TableName(System.String)
member.summary:
In this attribute, you can specify a name for the entity's database table.
Tips:
Always use Camel casing and Plural form
======== DEFAULT ================================
Plural form of the entity name specified at the time of creation
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you want to alter the name of the respective database table for the entity.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
Categories
EmailQueueItems
NewFeeds

member.name: M:MSharp.EntityType.ClassName(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field you specify the Name of the entity class.
Tips:
- Name your class based on the entity logic while focusing on real world objects
- Avoid lengthy Names meaningless names
- Using Camel case without spaces and in singular form
======== DEFAULT ================================
Same as entity name, but in Camel casing without spaces
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you want to change the name of the entity class.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
ApplicationEvent
Product

member.name: M:MSharp.EntityType.Schema(System.String)
member.summary:
In this attribute you can specify schema of the database table related to the entity. Data access code for the entity uses the scheme specified in this attribute
======== DEFAULT ================================
dbo
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you have database table schema different than the default.

member.name: M:MSharp.EntityType.SortDescending(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
When set to true, the elements of then entity sequences are sorted in descending order based on the sort property specified or default property
======== DEFAULT ================================
False
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you want to sort elements of a sequence in descending order
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
Email by sentDate
Payments By CreationDate

member.name: M:MSharp.EntityType.GenerateParseMethod(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
If set to True, a static method will be generated in entity class which returns the entity instance that is textually represented with a specified string value, or null if no such object is found.
Note:
- ArgumentNullException is thrown if the string argument is null or empty
- The text is compared with the default property as for entity type
======== DEFAULT ================================
False
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
Usually in situations of maintaining interoperability. When dealing with XML data exchange to external system.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
You receive XML serialized data from an external application and want to parse each xml element as an Employee

member.name: M:MSharp.EntityType.Sortable(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
When set to true, Entity definition will be amended with "ISortable" interface which will enable you to persist sort order
Tips:
You must implement an int type property named "Order"
======== DEFAULT ================================
False
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you want to persist sort order of an entity instances which can be changed as required
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
Entity types instances displayed in menus

member.name: M:MSharp.EntityType.Documentation(System.String)
member.summary: A description for the entity type to document its purpose. Make your descriptions as descriptive as possible as they will be generated as Comments above the entity definition.

member.name: M:MSharp.EntityType.Abstract(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
If set to True, entity class definition will be amended by Abstract keyword. Abstract type entities can not be instantiated and must be inherited in order to utilize the functionality.
======== DEFAULT ================================
False
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you want to encapsulate generic properties and behaviours in an entity is partial in nature and must be inherited in order to create concrete objects by extending the properties and behaviours of an entity
When you want to perform Polymorphism.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
User entity in M# which doesn't represent any concrete real world object but defines partial properties which are extended by inheriting it in other entities like Member, Employee or Admin

member.name: M:MSharp.EntityType.Name(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field you specify the Name of the entity.
Tips:
- Name your entity based on the business logic while focusing on real world objects
- Avoid lengthy Names meaningless names
- In M#, Always write name using Sentence case with spaces and in singular form
Note:
M# will generate entities and database tables using Camel case and plural form respectively
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
This is a mandatory field and is required at the time of creating an entity type
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
Application event
Product

member.name: M:MSharp.EntityType.PluralName(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field you can specify the plural name.
======== DEFAULT ================================
M# generated plural name based on the entity name

member.name: M:MSharp.EntityType.InstanceAccessors(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
If set to True, a public static Property (accessor ) will be generated for each instance using the default property of the entity.
Tips:
- You should avoid setting this attribute when application supports globalization.
- You must not set this attribute for an entity type which expects large number of records. You should
======== DEFAULT ================================
False
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you want to access instances of the entity type like an Enum type.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
You have OrderStatus entity and you want to access each instance to manage order stages
OrderStatus.Pending
OrderStatus.Completed
OrderStatus.Dispatched

member.name: M:MSharp.EntityType.Cachable(System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary:
If set to True, instances of the entity will be cached. All data access query will look in the cache first and then look in database tables
======== DEFAULT ================================
False
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you want to cache instances of the entity type having global scope in application in order to boost performance.
Incorrect usage of this attribute could prove anti performance
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
You have an ecommerce website which allows to filter products based on various attributes e.g. sizes, types, locations etc. You can mark the attribute related Entities cacheable.

member.name: M:MSharp.EntityType.SoftDelete(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
When set to True, entity instance are not deleted permanently rather a special database table column [.Deleted] of type bit is marked.
======== DEFAULT ================================
False
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you want to keep the log of deleted data for history and debugging in the same database table
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
EmailQueueItem Entity

member.name: M:MSharp.EntityType.ToStringExpression(System.String)
member.summary:
This is a C# expression field. You can specify the ToString expression which is used for string representation of each instance of the entity.
======== DEFAULT ================================
Default Property or the first string type property created
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
You want to represent each instance of the entity with a meaningful information on UI.
We often use combination of properties to display an instance on UI which could become difficult to maintain afterwards if a change is required.
Using this attribute you simple reference the instance and don't need to explicitly call properties and when a change is required you simply need to update this attribute.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
You want to represent each instance of a User entity using its FirstName and LastName Property
FirstName + " " + LastName
You want to display an address entity instances
new [] {BuildingNo, BuildingName, Street, City, Country, Postcode}.Except(string.Empty).ToString();

member.name: M:MSharp.EntityType.IsInterface(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
This attribute works in junction with Transient class. If Set to True, the entity definition is "Interface".
======== DEFAULT ================================
False
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
Interface are best suited when you want separate the definitions of objects from their implementation.

member.name: M:MSharp.EntityType.IsHirarchy(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
If set to True, the entity definition is extended with "IHierarchy" interface which is used to represent hierarchical data representation.
======== DEFAULT ================================
False
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you want to manipulate hierarchal data especially when using tree view control to render data
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
Categories with n level hierarchy.

member.name: M:MSharp.EntityType.TestInstanceNameExpression(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field you can specify a C# expression which will be used to generate the text instances. The expression must yield a unique name
Tips:
- use keyword "each" to reference each instance of the entity
- Follow the C# variable naming convention
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you want to generate desired text instance to make them unique and more robust
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
each.Name + "_" + each.Category
each.Email

member.name: M:MSharp.EntityType.Notes(System.String)
member.summary: In this field you can comment any notes related to the entity regarding implementation or logic. Be as descriptive while specifying notes as possible.

member.name: M:MSharp.EntityType.EagerLoadData(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
If set to True, all the association will be loaded in the memory in one call
======== DEFAULT ================================
False
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
It should be used very carefully as it could cause performance issues.
You should only set it to True, when you are sure that you will consume the child collection fetched eagerly

member.name: M:MSharp.EntityType.Associate``1(System.String,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Adds a many to one association to the specified type.

member.name: M:MSharp.EntityType.AssociateMany``1(System.String,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Adds a many to many association to the specified type.

member.name: M:MSharp.EntityType.Property(System.String)
member.summary: Gets a property that is already defined on this type or any of its parent types.

member.name: M:MSharp.Namespace.LogicCodeFolder(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field you can specify the folder name which will be created inside Logic folder to keep partial class for business logic implementation
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you want to place the business logic logic classes in a custom sub-folder in the default folders i.e. Logic
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
You need to create business logic classes for a referenced API and want to keep them in a separate folder

member.name: M:MSharp.Namespace.Name(System.String)
member.summary:
In this feed you can specify the name of the namespace which will be appeared in M# Modal section to logically group the entities
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
This is a mandatory field
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
Payment
Main

member.name: M:MSharp.Namespace.Schema(System.String)
member.summary:
In this attribute you can specify the schema of the database tables related to the entities created under this namespace
======== DEFAULT ================================
dbo
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need to apply a different scheme to database tables. All the database tables generated for entities will use this schema
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
Person
Language

member.name: M:MSharp.Namespace.CodeFolder(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field you can specify the folder name which will be created inside default to keep modal, mapping and Logic classes respectively
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you want to place the entity classes in a custom sub-folder in the default folders i.e. Entities, Mapping / DAL, Logic
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
You need to create mock classes form a referenced API and want to keep them in a separate folder

member.name: M:MSharp.Namespace.ModelCodeFolder(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field you can specify the folder name which will be created inside default to keep modal and mapping classes respectively
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you want to place the entity classes in a custom sub-folder in the default folders i.e. Entities, Mapping
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
You need to create mock classes form a referenced API and want to keep them in a separate folder

member.name: M:MSharp.NumberProperty.IsPercentage(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
If set to True, a percentage (%) sign is displayed along the property. The currency is set in project settings
======== DEFAULT ================================
False
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need to use the property as percentage field
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
You allow admin to supply discount rates
You have a property VAT rate for calculating Vat %

member.name: M:MSharp.NumberProperty.Name(System.String)
member.summary:
In this Property you specify the name of the property which is generated in Modal to access this property.
Note:
- Specify unique name in the entity
- Specify name in Camel case e.g. ResidenceAddress, ProductBatch, IsAllowed etc.
======== DEFAULT ================================
It is inferred from the title of the property
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
It is a mandatory property
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
ResidenceAddress
IsAllowed

member.name: M:MSharp.NumberProperty.Scale(System.Int32)
member.summary:
In this field you can specify the scaling of a double type property after decimal point
======== DEFAULT ================================
0
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need to manipulate monetary field and need to scale the value according to business rules
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
You have a product price which you want to scale up to 2 digits after decimal point
2

member.name: M:MSharp.NumberProperty.Mandatory(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
If set to True, a required validation rule will be generated in Modal and a required field validation control will be generated on UI to require the input.
This behaviour can be overridden in UI using same attribute of form element. But, if the property is marked as mandatory the rule will be applied in modal even if it is set to false in UI
======== DEFAULT ================================
False
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need to make a field mandatory for an entity instance

member.name: M:MSharp.NumberProperty.Min(System.String)
member.summary:
In this attribute you can specify a numeric value which is treated as the minimum valid value for this property. A validation rule is generated in Modal and a validation control is generated on UI.
======== DEFAULT ================================
0
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need to impose a minimum valid value for a numeric field
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
Static Expression
10
Dynamic Expression
App.Settings.MiniumPayment

member.name: M:MSharp.NumberProperty.Max(System.String)
member.summary:
In this attribute you can specify a numeric value which is treated as the maximum valid value for this property. A validation rule is generated in Modal and a validation control is generated on UI.
======== DEFAULT ================================
Maximum value of the numeric type
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need to impose a maximum valid value for a numeric field
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
Static Expression
10
Dynamic Expression
App.Settings.MaximumQuanity

member.name: M:MSharp.NumberProperty.Title(System.String)
member.summary:
In this Property you specify the title of the property which is generated as the label in the module
Note:
- Specify unique name in the entity
- Specify name in normal case e.g. Residence address, Product batch, Is allowed? etc.
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
It is a mandatory property
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
Residence address
Is allowed?

member.name: M:MSharp.NumberProperty.IsCurrency(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
If set to True, a currency sign is displayed along the property. The currency is set in project settings
======== DEFAULT ================================
False
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need to have the property as monetary field
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
Price of a product
Account Balance of a customer

member.name: M:MSharp.NumberProperty.AutoNumber(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
If set to True, the property will be treated as the auto number is database table
======== DEFAULT ================================
False
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you don't want to manage the numeric sequence when need to have an property as serial numbers
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
You manage a books store and and want to assign a serial number using numeric auto number property

member.name: M:MSharp.NumberProperty.Unique(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
If set to True, a unique validation rule for this property will generated in the Modal which will prevent duplicate values.
Also, a static method will be generated which finds and retunes an instance from the database by the property's value
The method name is inferred from the property name. e.g Marking a property "Email" as unique will generate a method "FindByEmail"
======== DEFAULT ================================
False
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
Use this attribute when you want to make a property value unique
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
Email Address
Telephone Numbers
User IDs

member.name: M:MSharp.NumberProperty.Notes(System.String)
member.summary: A description for the property to document any notes. Make your descriptions as descriptive as possible as they will be helpful later on to understand the Business Logic.

member.summary:
In this field you can specify custom C# attribute(s) for the property.

======== EXAMPLES ===============================
[Serializable]
[XmlIgnore]

member.summary:
When set to True, the property will not be serialized when xml serialization will be performed on the instance
======== DEFAULT ================================
False
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need to perform XML serialization and When you want to omit the property value

member.name: M:MSharp.NumberProperty.Override(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
If set to true, Override keyword will be generated for the property
======== DEFAULT ================================
False
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you have defined a virtual property in the base class and want to override the property in the derived class

member.name: M:MSharp.NumberProperty.Virtual(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
If set to True, "Virtual" keyword will be generated in the property definition
======== DEFAULT ================================
False
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you are defining a base class and want to override this property in derived classes

member.summary:

Inferred form the property name
e.g. Please provide a value for Email
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need to display a dynamic validation message which requires business logic.

In this field you can specify a C# expression to implement the get accessory of a calculated property

In this field you can specify a static or c# expression based value which is set as the default value of the property in entity class constructor

When you want to specify a default vale for a property
======== EXAMPLES ===============================

LocalTime.Now
You have a field DicountCode which you want auto generate
GenerateDiscountCode()

member.summary:
In this field you can specify the string format for a property which will be used to format the string on UI.
======== S WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ============

======== EXAMPLES ===============================

d

member.name: M:MSharp.NumberProperty.IsReadOnlyInterfaceProperty(System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary:
If set to True, only the get accessor will be generated.

False
