This is useful in scenarios when you want to have field which needs to be initialized at runtime time which should not be changed.
Although, Constant variables are used as well but they cannot have dynamic value or initialized at runtime

member.name: M:MSharp.Project.StyleRequiredFormElements(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
If set to True, a css class "required-item" is applied on the container html element of a form element which is marked as mandatory in Modal or UI.
Note:
- You must define "required-item" style in you css file according to you design requirement
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
It is very useful when you need to distinguish required fields on a form. It saves time by automatically applying css class rather you specify the css class on individual element.

member.name: M:MSharp.Project.Encoding(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field you can specify the default encoding which is also used to as the default encoding for CSV and excel data handling
======== DEFAULT ================================
UTF-8
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
Although, the default Unicode character set UTF-8 encoding supports wide range or charters but you can supply a specific encoding required in the project
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
For Western Languages ANSI Encoding
Windows-1252
ASCI
SO-8859-1

member.name: M:MSharp.Project.EntitiesStructureTestFolder(System.String)
member.summary:
In this attribute you can specify the folder name for text structure classes which define properties and validators for entity objects
======== DEFAULT ================================
Structure

member.name: M:MSharp.Project.IsMultiLingual(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
If set to True, language translation support will be activated to translate the page contents to other languages
Please read Configuring M# for Multi Languages for more information on setting up multi-lingual support
======== DEFAULT ================================
False
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need to enable multi-language support for full websites

member.name: M:MSharp.Project.AvoidColonForFormElements(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
If set to True, the colons (:) at the end of each label for form input controls will not be generated.
======== DEFAULT ================================
False
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you don't want to generate colons (:) at the end of each label used for input control on form modules

member.name: M:MSharp.Project.CopyrightCompany(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field you can specify the company name which is used to generate the copyright headers in each class of the project.
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you want to generate copyright headers to personalise the code
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
Geeks Ltd

member.name: M:MSharp.Project.AvoidColonForViewElements(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
If set to True, the colons (:) at the end of each label in view module will not be generated.
======== DEFAULT ================================
False
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you don't want to generate colons (:) at the end of each label in view module

member.name: M:MSharp.Project.RequiredValidationMessageTemplate(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field you can specify a template for validation message.
Tips:
- Use {0} keyword to reference the message in you template
- Html markup will not be rendered in message box style
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you want to apply special appearance style for validation messages.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
{0}
{0}

member.name: M:MSharp.Project.BasePageClassName(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field you can specify a class name which will be inherited by each page class (.aspx.cs) created in M#.
Tips
- Inherit M# Page base class in your custom base class to retain the useful features.
======== DEFAULT ================================
MSharp.Framework.UI.Page
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need to customize the pages and need to use a base class e.g. To override cultureInitialization
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
MyCustomClass
MyProject.BaseClass

member.name: M:MSharp.Project.UseUtcDatetimeFormat(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
When set to True, System.DateTime value will be Converted the to Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).
======== DEFAULT ================================
False
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
It is good to always store DateTime in UTC format for enterprise and globalized applications and display DateTime in local time zone.
Use UTC especially in forums where you record DateTime automatically e.g. DatePosted, DateReplied etc. The benefit is that the records always sorted correctly
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
You have a social website hosted on different servers in different zones and users around the world post contents using their local server.
In this scenario, you should store DateTime in UTC format. This will help in keeping message threads in correct date order even the Time zone is different.
But remember that you should always display dates in local time zone.

member.name: M:MSharp.Project.Name(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field you can specify the name of the project. Which is also used to generate the assembly name
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
It is a mandatory field which is set at the time of creating the project

member.name: M:MSharp.Project.GeneratedClassesFolder(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field you can specify a folder name for generated entity structure classes
======== DEFAULT ================================
Entities
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need to alter the name of the generated partial entity structure classes
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
Structures
Entities/Definitions

member.name: M:MSharp.Project.GeneratedDALFolder(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field you can specify the folder name for mapping classes i.e. Data Access Classes
======== DEFAULT ================================
DAL (ADo.NET)
Mappings(MS Entity Framework / NHibernate)
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you want to alter the data access classes folder
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
DAL/SQLDataAccess
SQLDAL

member.name: M:MSharp.Project.RootUrl(System.String)
member.summary:
In this attribute you can specify the Location of the project
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
It is mandatory field and is specified at the time of creating a project

member.name: M:MSharp.Project.DataAccessNamespace(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field you can specify the data access class(es) namespace. These classes encapsulate the mappings of entity and database tables
Tips:
_ You will have to replace the "providerFactoryType" attribute of DataProviderModal section in web.config with the namespace you specify in this attribute
======== DEFAULT ================================
AppData
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
It is advised to keep the default namespace as it may cause data access issues, but you can use any custom namespace to personalise the data access logic
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
SqlDataAccess
OLEDBDataAccess

member.name: M:MSharp.Project.DataAccessStrategy(MSharp.DataAccessStrategy)
member.summary:
In this field you can choose the data persistence infrastructure. You can choose one of the three available frameworks
- ADO.Net
- MS Entity FrameWork
- NHibernate
======== DEFAULT ================================
Ado.Net
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you want to use the alternate data access strategy based on project and performance requirements.
Please note that changing the data access strategy mid way through the development may cause discrepancies

member.name: M:MSharp.Project.ValidationStyle(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field you can specify the default validation style(s) to show the validation messages on pages. You can choose single or combination of the following styles
- Error text after Control
- Error text before Control
- Error text before label
- Error text after label
- Callout box
- Full message
- Message Box
- Summary Box
Note:
- Some combinations cannot be used e.g first four of above together
======== DEFAULT ================================
Message Box,Error text after control
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need to customise the validation styles based on the appearance and design style of the website
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
Message Box,Error text after label, Callout box
Error text after label, Callout box

member.name: M:MSharp.Project.DefaultCurrency(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field you can specify the default currency sign which will appear beside monetary fields in modules
======== DEFAULT ================================
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need to manipulate a different currency in the project other than Pound Sterling ()
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
$
€

member.name: M:MSharp.Project.SolutionFile(System.String)
member.summary:
In this attribute you can specify the VS solution file name for the project
======== DEFAULT ================================
The name is inferred from the Project name
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
It is a mandatory field and is automatically specified at the time of creating a project

member.name: M:MSharp.Project.AvoidColonForSearchElements(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
If set to True, the colons (:) at the end of each label for search box input controls will not be generated.

False

When you don't want to generate colons (:) at the end of each label used for input control in search boxes

member.name: M:MSharp.Project.PageModuleContainerCss(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field, you can set css class(es) for module container element. A "div" html element is generated with the specified css class(es).
This attribute can be overridden by specifying same attribute for master page template
Tips:
- css classes should always be lower case.
- Use "-" to separate the words in the css class.
- Use " " to separate multiple css classes.
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When a special appearance style is needed for the modules.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
border-round
border-round box-thin-shadow
c#: (Case != null) ? "case-border" : ""

Visual Studio

When you want to generate unit test using MbUnit framework. It depends on the unit test requirement when you use which framework.

member.name: M:MSharp.Project.AutoTask(System.String,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Adds an automated task plan.

member.name: M:MSharp.Property.Name(System.String)
member.summary:
In this Property you specify the name of the property which is generated in Modal to access this property.
Note:
- Specify unique name in the entity
- Specify name in Camel case e.g. ResidenceAddress, ProductBatch, IsAllowed etc.
======== DEFAULT ================================
It is inferred from the title of the property
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
It is a mandatory property
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
ResidenceAddress
IsAllowed

member.name: M:MSharp.Property.Mandatory(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
If set to True, a required validation rule will be generated in Modal and a required field validation control will be generated on UI to require the input.
This behaviour can be overridden in UI using same attribute of form element. But, if the property is marked as mandatory the rule will be applied in modal even if it is set to false in UI
======== DEFAULT ================================
False
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need to make a field mandatory for an entity instance

member.name: M:MSharp.Property.Title(System.String)
member.summary:
In this Property you specify the title of the property which is generated as the label in the module
Note:
- Specify unique name in the entity
- Specify name in normal case e.g. Residence address, Product batch, Is allowed? etc.
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
It is a mandatory property
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
Residence address
Is allowed?

member.name: M:MSharp.Property.Unique(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
If set to True, a unique validation rule for this property will generated in the Modal which will prevent duplicate values.
Also, a static method will be generated which finds and retunes an instance from the database by the property's value
The method name is inferred from the property name. e.g Marking a property "Email" as unique will generate a method "FindByEmail"
======== DEFAULT ================================
False
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
Use this attribute when you want to make a property value unique
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
Email Address
Telephone Numbers
User IDs

member.name: M:MSharp.Property.Notes(System.String)
member.summary: A description for the property to document any notes. Make your descriptions as descriptive as possible as they will be helpful later on to understand the Business Logic.

member.name: M:MSharp.Property.Attributes(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field you can specify custom C# attribute(s) for the property.
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need to apply custom C# attributes on the property.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
[Serializable]
[XmlIgnore]

member.name: M:MSharp.Property.XmlIgnore(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
When set to True, the property will not be serialized when xml serialization will be performed on the instance
======== DEFAULT ================================
False
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need to perform XML serialization and When you want to omit the property value

member.name: M:MSharp.Property.Override(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
If set to true, Override keyword will be generated for the property
======== DEFAULT ================================
False
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you have defined a virtual property in the base class and want to override the property in the derived class

member.name: M:MSharp.Property.Virtual(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
If set to True, "Virtual" keyword will be generated in the property definition
======== DEFAULT ================================
False
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you are defining a base class and want to override this property in derived classes

member.name: M:MSharp.Property.RequiredValidationMessage(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field you can specify a message which is displayed when the property value is null
======== DEFAULT ================================
Inferred form the property name
e.g. Please provide a value for Email
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need to display a dynamic validation message which requires business logic.

member.name: M:MSharp.Property.DatabaseIndex(System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary:
If set to True, database index is generated for the property. Index are created to boost up the speed of data retrieval but downgrades the data writing speed if used unnecessary.
======== DEFAULT ================================
False
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When the property is going to be used rigorously to retrieve data from the database.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
Unique fields which are going to be parameterised often in data retrieval
Identity Fields

member.name: M:MSharp.Property.Calculated(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
If set to True, the property is only generated in Modal entity class and no respective column is generated in database table
======== DEFAULT ================================
False
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need to generate calculated properties especially when you need to display the value on UI
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
You have FirstName and LastName as separate properties and want to create a property FullName which retunes the concatenation of both the FirstName and LastName Properties
You want to show Customer balance which required calculation you can implement a private method to calculate the balance and call that in calculated property to display it on UI

member.name: M:MSharp.Property.Documentation(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field you can specify contents which are generated in the documentation summary tag of the poetry
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
It is good practice to provide documentation of properties to make it more useable for consumer of the property or the developer who are going to manipulate it later on.

member.name: M:MSharp.Property.HelpText(System.String)
member.summary:
In this property you can specify contends which are displayed as the help text for the property.
This property is also available in form module
======== S WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ============
When you need to display a dynamic help text property which requires Business Logic.
Use Form Module element attribute "help text " to specify static help text with html markup.

member.name: M:MSharp.Property.Getter(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field you can specify a C# expression to implement the get accessory of a calculated property
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you have a calculated property and want to implement custom get accessor
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
CalculateBalance()
FirstName + " " + LastName

member.name: M:MSharp.Property.Default(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field you can specify a static or c# expression based value which is set as the default value of the property in entity class constructor
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you want to specify a default vale for a property
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
You have a DateTime field DateCreated
LocalTime.Now
You have a field DicountCode which you want auto generate
GenerateDiscountCode()

member.name: M:MSharp.Property.DefaultFormatString(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field you can specify the string format for a property which will be used to format the string on UI.
======== S WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ============
It is useful in cases of specifying a default format for DateTime and Numeric value to be printed on the screen using a default format string.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
You have DateTime property DateCreated which you want to show only short date on UI
d
You have DateTime property DateCreated which you want to show custom date format
dd/MMM/yyyy
You have Numeric field and want to add leading zeros if the value is less than 4 digits
D4

member.name: M:MSharp.Property.IsReadOnlyInterfaceProperty(System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary:
If set to True, only the get accessor will be generated.
======== DEFAULT ================================
False
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
This is useful in scenarios when you want to have field which needs to be initialized at runtime time which should not be changed.
Although, Constant variables are used as well but they cannot have dynamic value or initialized at runtime

member.name: M:MSharp.StringProperty.HashPassword(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Use this property if you wish to store the password fields values encrypted/hashed in your database.
This will make your application more secure, since you do not store the passwords in the database in clear format
Note:
You will not be able to recover the user passwords anymore, you only can reset hashed passwords.
======== DEFAULT ================================
False
The passwords are stored in clear format in the database.
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
Additional level of security.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
True
Hashed password
False
Clear text password

member.name: M:MSharp.StringProperty.Name(System.String)
member.summary:
In this Property you specify the name of the property which is generated in Modal to access this property.
Note:
- Specify unique name in the entity
- Specify name in Camel case e.g. ResidenceAddress, ProductBatch, IsAllowed etc.
======== DEFAULT ================================
It is inferred from the title of the property
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
It is a mandatory property
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
ResidenceAddress
IsAllowed

member.name: M:MSharp.StringProperty.Accepts(MSharp.TextPattern)
member.summary:
Use this field to use an alternative text patterns for the text fields in the model. These patterns affect the appearance, behaviour and validation rules for this field.
The available options are:
- Email address
- Internet URL
- ISBN
- Limited company number
- Password
- Scotland Limited Company Number
- Social Security Number (USA)
- U.K. Post code
- U.K. Post code - 2 parts
- U.S. Phone Number
======== DEFAULT ================================
Blank, which means the text field is not going to have any special formatting/behaviour.
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
Use this attribute to specialised text fields to one of the options above.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
Email address
Password

member.name: M:MSharp.StringProperty.Mandatory(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
If set to True, a required validation rule will be generated in Modal and a required field validation control will be generated on UI to require the input.
This behaviour can be overridden in UI using same attribute of form element. But, if the property is marked as mandatory the rule will be applied in modal even if it is set to false in UI
======== DEFAULT ================================
False
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need to make a field mandatory for an entity instance

member.name: M:MSharp.StringProperty.Lines(System.Nullable{System.Int32})
member.summary:
Specifies the number of lines to use for the textboxes when rending the forms for this element on this entity.
By default, every text field will be displayed in a control, but if you enter a number larger than 1, then it will be rendered as a TextArea field.
======== DEFAULT ================================
Blank (i.e. 1), all the text fields are rendered in one lines in forms.
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
In order to convert a text field to a TextArea in the forms.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
10 10 Lines

member.name: M:MSharp.StringProperty.TrimValues(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
A Boolean field to specify whether the model should trim the string values, removing empty spaces at the beginning and the end of the string, before saving it into database.
======== DEFAULT ================================
True
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
By default, M# trims all string values. If you want to change this behaviour, you have to set it to false.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
True
Trims the string values.
False
Does not trim the string values.

200
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
In case you want to save values with larger string sizes or smaller ones.

2000
A string field with maximum 2000 characters
8

member.name: M:MSharp.UniquenessRule.ErrorMessage(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field you can specify plain text message which will be display when the uniqueness validation rule is failed. Be descriptive in specifying the merge which should convey the error meaningfully
======== DEFAULT ================================
Inferred form the uniqueness rule
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
Although the default error message is descriptive enough but you can specify a more specific error message if and when required.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
There is already a record with same category and product in the database
There is already an address with the same house number, postcode and member in the database.

member.name: M:MSharp.UniquenessRuleElement.TreatNullAsValue(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
If set to True, the null value will be treated as valid value and unique rule will throw valuation even if more than one null value is passed in the properties related to uniqueness rule
======== DEFAULT ================================
False
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
In scenarios where you allow user to pass in null values which are included in uniqueness rule.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
You save products with association of Category but some of products may not have the category associated. But you also don't want to add the same product twice without a category.
You can set this attribute on uniqueness rule which will throw warning if the a product with null category is added more than once

member.name: M:MSharp.ApplicationPage.MarkupTemplate(System.String)
member.summary:

======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you want to layout a page and customize the arrangement of the modules registered on this page
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
Example 1
[#1#]
[#2#]
Example 2
[#1#]
[#2#]

member.name: M:MSharp.ApplicationPage.BaseController(System.String)
member.summary:
Each page code behind class inherits MSharp.Framework.UI.Page class. Specifying any class name in this attribute will replace the base class of the code behind class of this page.
======== DEFAULT ================================

======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you want to inherit a custom base class for the code behind class.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
Example 1

Example 2
MyNamespace.CustomPageSecurity

member.name: M:MSharp.ApplicationPage.CommentTag(System.String)
member.summary:
Any tag specified here will be shown before the page name in user interface section
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you want to tag a page for readability and ease of maintenance
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
Example 1
01
Example 2
Secure

member.name: M:MSharp.ApplicationPage.Name(System.String)
member.summary:
Sets the name of this page. The ASPX page will be generated based on this name.
Remember that it will be visible to the user in the browser address bar. Use a descriptive clear and short name.
Notes:
- M# will automatically replace space with hyphen.
- Do not use Pascal or Camel casing. Use separate clear words in plain English.
- A page's name together with its full hierarchy (name of its parent page, grand parent, etc) should characterise the page.
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
Every page must have a name.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
Forgot password
The name should be in clear English with capital casing for the first word and spaces between words.
Users
Sign up
Forgot password
The name should be set in the hierarchy context.

member.name: M:MSharp.ApplicationPage.BrowserTitle(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field you can specify a browser title for the page.
The resulting text will be rendered in the output HTML page in tag under area.
======== DEFAULT ================================
By default the generated title of each page will be generated as the path to the page, separated with " | " , where each page/node in the path is represented by it's title/name.
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
It's important to set it to a SEO friendly value if this page is a public facing page and search engines need to index it.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
MyWebsite.com | Contact us
c#: "User edit - " + App.Context.User.UserName

member.name: M:MSharp.ApplicationPage.Layout(MSharp.MasterPage)
member.summary:
In this field you can specify the template of the page.
Note:
Be careful in selecting this template because your page totally is related to this template in visualization.
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
This field is mandatory and is set at the time of creating a page.

member.name: M:MSharp.ApplicationPage.Roles(MSharp.ProjectRole[])
member.summary:
Use this attribute to select role(s) allowed to access this page.
Note:
The page will only be accessible to the user of specified roles
======== DEFAULT ================================
Guest
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need to enforce role based security.

member.name: M:MSharp.ApplicationPage.StyleDefinitions(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field you can define inline css classes and rules. All css classes defined here are generated on the page inside tag
Note:
Always define css styles and rules in css files and try to avoid inline css style definitions
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
In a very specific case when you need to use inline css styles
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
Example 1
.two-column-page { width:980px;}
Example 2
div.readmore > a { font-size:9pt;}

member.name: M:MSharp.ApplicationPage.ControllerCustomCode(System.String)
M:MSharp.ApplicationPage.ValidateRequest(System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary:
If this field is set to False the system stops to validate incoming requests.
Note:
Setting this to False could make it vulnerable to Cross Site Scripting
======== DEFAULT ================================
False
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
This is done in pages which you want to allow user enter HTML contents.

member.name: M:MSharp.ApplicationPage.EnableSSL(System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary:
If set to True, the page will be served only on https protocol
If set to false, page is served on Http protocol only
======== DEFAULT ================================
Auto, system
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you want to setup a page explicitly for secure or unsecure web protocol

member.name: M:MSharp.ApplicationPage.RootCssClass(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field you can specify a css class of the page. Specifying a css class will generate a container element "span" with the given class and all the registered modules will be placed inside this container element.
Tips:
- css classes should always be lower case.
- Use "-" to separate the words in the css class.
- Use " " to separate multiple css classes.
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need to apply any page specific design or layout related css
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
Example 1
two-column-form
Example 2
compact-view user-order-view
Example 3
c#: (Case != null) ? "progress-list" : ""

member.name: M:MSharp.ApplicationPage.ControllerAttributes(System.String)
member.summary:
Any attribute specified here will be generated in the @page directive.
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
Use this attribute to specify any attribute not available in M#.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
Example 1
Debug="true"
Example 2
EnableEventValidation="false"

member.name: M:MSharp.ApplicationPage.UrlSegment(System.String)
member.summary:
Normally the children of this page get the name of this page as part of their url.
If you want to remove this from its children's urls, then set UrlSegment to [#EMPTY#].
Or if you want it to be shorter than its name, then provide a brief value.
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
For example if your deep page has the value of /administrator/cms/products/view/{id}
you can use UrlSegment on the parent pages to turn it into:
/admin/products/{id}

member.name: M:MSharp.Button.RepeatDataSource(System.String)
member.summary:
This is a C# expression field. In this field you can specify a collection type data source.
If the data source is specified, M# generates an asp.net "Repeater Control" with the specified "DataSource" and placed the button as the "ItemTemplate" of the "Repeater Control"
Tip:
- You can access each public property / method of each element of the data source sequence in other attributes of the same button e.g. Image URL, Text etc.
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
This attribute is very useful when you want to render multiple button based on a DataSource e.g. List of users to link their profiles or Products of a category
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
You want to render buttons for all the active users with FullName as the button text
Repeat data source: Item.GetActiveEmployees()
Text: C#: (Container.DataItem as Employee).FullName
You want to render buttons for a category products with thumbnail images and link to the View Page
Repeat data source: Item.Products
Image URL: C#: (Container.DataItem as Product).Photo.Url()
Query String: C#: (Container.DataItem as Product).ID

member.name: M:MSharp.Button.Text(System.String)
member.summary:
You should enter the display text of the button in this field.
Supported formats:
- Plain text
- c# expression
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
To set the display text of the button.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
Add user
c#: string.Format("Add {0}th user", App.Context.Users.Count() + 1)

member.name: M:MSharp.Button.CausesValidation(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
If set to True, the Validation will be performed on the module when the button is clicked.
======== DEFAULT ================================
True (Except Cancel Button which is generated at the time of creating a module)
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you don't want to perform validation on button click.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
For cancel button which you don't want to validate the page and just leave it.

member.name: M:MSharp.Button.IsDefault(System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary:
If Set to True, the button is made the default button on the page which is triggered when the return key is pressed.
Note:
You can only have one button as the default button in a module.
When a button is set as Default button using this attribute then this attribute is set as False for all the other buttons
======== DEFAULT ================================
False (Except Save button which is generated at the time of creating a Form Module )
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you want to set the button as the default focused button.

member.name: M:MSharp.Button.ConfirmQuestion(System.String)
member.summary:
If you enter a text in this field, the system will show a confirmation message to the end user when they click this button.
If the user then selects No, the operation will be terminated and the button workflow will not run.
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you want to confirm something when users clicks the button.
It's used mostly in Delete operations or any other sensitive action.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
Are you sure?
c#: "Are you sure you want to delete " + Item + "?"

member.name: M:MSharp.Button.ImageUrl(System.String)

member.name: M:MSharp.MenuItem.Key(System.String)
member.summary:
A unique key expression for this menu item.
Notes:
1. This key will be used to highlight the "selected item" of this menu by adding a css class of "selected" if the "currently requested page or arguments" match with this key.
2. This expression or static key should match with the expression written in "Selected item key" of the menu itself.
======== DEFAULT ================================
The default value will be the c# encoded text of the menu item (such as "AboutUs" for a link saying "About us").
For dynamic items with a data source, it will be the ID of the item.
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When the default generated keys do not guarantee uniqueness of keys across all menu items, you will need to use this to ensure all generated menu items have unique Keys at runtime.
For example use it when you have:
- Multiple dynamic menu items on the same data source objects
- Multiple static links to one page with different Query String parameters.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
ImageGallery
A fixed constant key is used in this example
c#:ITEM.ID
The upper case "ITEM" keyword must be used when the menu is in "Generate Links" mode.
c#:item.ID
The lower case "item" keyword must be used when the menu is NOT in "Generate Links" mode.
c#:ITEM.Name
c#:item.Key + "CustomText"

In this field you can specify heading for the module. All contents are placed inside h2 tag.
======== DEFAULT ================================
Inferred from the entity and type of module
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you wan to specify just the heading contents
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
Static Text
Employee Details
C# Expression
c#:Item.Name + " Details"

member.name: M:MSharp.MenuModule.ItemLayout(System.String)
member.summary:
In this attributer you specify customize the menu item makeup
Tips
- Use "[#Link#]" as a placeholder for the generated link.
- Use this only in "Generate Links" mode.
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need style the menu items for special appeared or need to display custom contents around the menu options
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
[#Link#]
My Custom Contents
[#Link#]

member.name: M:MSharp.MenuModule.SpecialSelectedKeyRule(System.String)
member.summary:
A C# statement that returns a string value specifying the key of the selected item based on a special criteria .
That value will be matched with the "Key" attribute of every menu item and will highlight the matched item as selected (by adding css class of "selected" to that item).
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
If you have any dynamic menu items in this menu, for properly highlighting the correct item, a correct expression should be specified here.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
if (Request.Has(".category"))
return Request[".category"];

member.name: M:MSharp.MenuModule.Name(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field you should enter the name of the module you want to create. This name should be a unique name for the module you have created.
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
This is a mandatory field for the module.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
Form: User signup
List: Content blocks
View: User details

The markup to add at the beginning of this module's content.

Simple Heading!
On a form or view module.
On a list module.

member.name: M:MSharp.MenuModule.NamespaceImports(MSharp.NamespaceImport[])
member.summary:
In this field you can choose namespace(s) you need to import in the page backend.
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================

you need to extract web control in the backend file of a list module in order to manipulate the data

member.name: M:MSharp.MenuModule.IsInUse(System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary:
In this field you can specify if the module is used and should be build or not.
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
If your module is used in a page directly, it will be built in build actions automatically.
If your module is not used in a page directly, but you still want it to be built, you should check this property.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
Menu Modules

member.summary:

"ICallbackEventHandler, IAnotherInterface"

member.summary:
In this field, you can enter a custom css class for the wrapper of this group.
Tips:

======== EXAMPLES ===============================
user-box-wrapper
left-aside user-box-wrapper

member.name: M:MSharp.ModuleBox.Name(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field you should provide a name for this group.
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
This is a mandatory field for the group.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
"Top left box"
c#: "Something " + Item.Something

member.name: M:MSharp.ModuleBox.Text(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field you should enter the display text of the group i.e. a heading for the box group.
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
To set the display text of the group.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
Add user
c#: string.Format("Add {0}th user", App.Context.Users.Count() + 1)

member.name: M:MSharp.ModuleBox.CssClass(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field, you can set a css class for this group.
Tips:
- css classes should always be lower case.
- Use "-" to separate the words in the css class.
- Use " " to separate multiple css classes.
======== DEFAULT ================================
By default the css class of the group is decided based on the Template property.
Examples:
- If the Template is set to "Box with left icon", a css class of "box-with-left-icon" is applied.
- If the Template is set to "Properties box", a css class of "properties-box" is applied.
- If the Template is set to "Ajax Tab Panel", no css class is applied.
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When an special appearance style is needed for the group.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
add-user-group
add-group add-user-group
c#: (Case != null) ? "selected-group" : ""

member.name: M:MSharp.ModuleBox.Template(MSharp.BoxTemplate)
member.summary:
In this field you have a wide range of choices for the layout of the group.
======== DEFAULT ================================
By default the template of the group is set to the "Just H3 Header" template.
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
This is a mandatory field for the group.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
"Collapsible panel"
"Simple wrapper (Span)"

======== EXAMPLES ===============================
Title
[#GROUP#]

member.name: M:MSharp.ModuleBox.NoText
member.summary: Sets the text of this element to be [#EMPTY#] which means no text should be generated.

member.name: M:MSharp.ModuleButton.RepeatDataSource(System.String)
member.summary:
This is a C# expression field. In this field you can specify a collection type data source.
If the data source is specified, M# generates an asp.net "Repeater Control" with the specified "DataSource" and placed the button as the "ItemTemplate" of the "Repeater Control"
Tip:
- You can access each public property / method of each element of the data source sequence in other attributes of the same button e.g. Image URL, Text etc.
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
This attribute is very useful when you want to render multiple button based on a DataSource e.g. List of users to link their profiles or Products of a category
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
You want to render buttons for all the active users with FullName as the button text
Repeat data source: Item.GetActiveEmployees()
Text: C#: (Container.DataItem as Employee).FullName
You want to render buttons for a category products with thumbnail images and link to the View Page
Repeat data source: Item.Products
Image URL: C#: (Container.DataItem as Product).Photo.Url()
Query String: C#: (Container.DataItem as Product).ID

member.name: M:MSharp.ModuleButton.Box(MSharp.ModuleBox)
member.summary:
In this field you can choose a box for the button. The button will be placed inside the box
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need to fulfil special appearance style or functionality requirement
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
You have two boxes, One to edit Personal detail and other to edit Contact details you can have two have button to be placed in each box
You have find by postcode textbox and want to place the Find button and textbox control in one box.

member.name: M:MSharp.ModuleButton.Text(System.String)
member.summary:
You should enter the display text of the button in this field.
Supported formats:
- Plain text
- c# expression
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
To set the display text of the button.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
Add user
c#: string.Format("Add {0}th user", App.Context.Users.Count() + 1)

member.name: M:MSharp.ModuleButton.CausesValidation(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
If set to True, the Validation will be performed on the module when the button is clicked.
======== DEFAULT ================================
True (Except Cancel Button which is generated at the time of creating a module)
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you don't want to perform validation on button click.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
For cancel button which you don't want to validate the page and just leave it.

member.name: M:MSharp.ModuleButton.IsDefault(System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary:
If Set to True, the button is made the default button on the page which is triggered when the return key is pressed.
Note:
You can only have one button as the default button in a module.
When a button is set as Default button using this attribute then this attribute is set as False for all the other buttons
======== DEFAULT ================================
False (Except Save button which is generated at the time of creating a Form Module )
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you want to set the button as the default focused button.

member.name: M:MSharp.ModuleButton.ConfirmQuestion(System.String)
member.summary:
If you enter a text in this field, the system will show a confirmation message to the end user when they click this button.
If the user then selects No, the operation will be terminated and the button workflow will not run.
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you want to confirm something when users clicks the button.
It's used mostly in Delete operations or any other sensitive action.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
Are you sure?
c#: "Are you sure you want to delete " + Item + "?"

member.name: M:MSharp.ModuleButton.ImageUrl(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field you can set as Image URL for the button.
Tips:
- If this field is set, then the type of the button will be automatically set to Image.
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you want to specify an image for the button.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
icons/delete.gif

member.name: M:MSharp.ModuleButton.MarkupTemplate(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field you can specify custom markup to wrap or place this button as required
Note:
You must use [#Button#] keyword to place the button in required position in the markup specified
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you want to implement custom markup to design a button look-n-feel
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
[#Button#]
[#Button#]

member.name: M:MSharp.ModuleButton.Style(MSharp.ButtonStyle)
member.summary:
In this field you can specify type of appearance for the button.
Note:
-
If the text is set by c# expressions, the type can not be Image.
======== DEFAULT ================================
If not set, the system automatically decides which type it should use.
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you want a specific type of button.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
Set to "Link" if you want the button to be a link.

member.name: M:MSharp.ModuleButton.Tooltip(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field you can specify contents which are shown as the tooltip of the button
Supports:
1. Static Text
2. C# Expression

member.summary:
This property is used in junction with the previous property "Repeat Data source".
Contents specified in this property are places in the "SeparatorTemplate" of "Asp.Net Repeater" control.
You can specify static or dynamic mark-up contents in this field.
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need to visually separate the button control to make it more detailed and sophisticated.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================

member.name: M:MSharp.ModuleButton.Name(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field you specify the Name of the button.
Tip:
- The name should not begin with keyword "btn" as this is automatically applied
- The Name must be given without spaces and in camel casing

The text specified at the time of creating button.
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you want to rename the button.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
AddNewEmployee
ProcessPayment
Cancel

member.summary:
In this field you can specify attributes pre-defined / custom attributes for the buttons

This field is rarely used, only when an extra attribute(s) are needed which cannot be specified using other attributes.

Example 2
PostBackUrl="~/Pages/Members/Enter.aspx"

member.summary:
In this field you specify an icon for the button.

member.name: M:MSharp.ModuleCodeExtension.Event(MSharp.UIModuleEvent)
member.summary:
In this field you should specify the scope of the code you are writing.
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
Class code: if you are writing a method or property etc.
CSS style : if you are writing a css style code.
Initialization: If you want to write a code which will be added to OnInit method.
JavaScript: If you want to write a JavaScript code.
Load : If you want the code to be added to OnLoad method.
Prerender: If you want the code to be added to OnPreRender
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
You want to initialize control on load
You want to write some class code to perform server side functionality

Extracting control from a list row

member.name: M:MSharp.ModuleProperty.FromRequestParam(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field you can specify a QueryString key from which the property will be calculated.
Note:
- For a property of complex type the the instance is get from database based on the QueryString supplied
- For a property of custom type the the value is converted and calculated from the QueryString supplied
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
when you need to define the get accessor of the property from QueryString
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
You have a property of a complex type App.Employee and you specify a QueryString "id"
Request.Get ("id");
You have a a property of custom type int and you specified QueryString "qty"
Request["qty"].To ()

member.name: M:MSharp.ModuleProperty.Disabled(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
If set to True, The code will be disabled.
======== DEFAULT ================================
False
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you don't want to use your code in the module anymore but you don't like to remove it, you can simply check this field.

member.name: M:MSharp.ModuleProperty.RetainInPost(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
If set to True, a hidden field will be generated to retain the value of this property in post (ajax) requests.
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you set the value of this property in the container page (or module) later on when the module is posted back (e.g. Save button) that value gets lost.
In that case if you set this to true, then the value will be retained in a hidden field on the client.
======== BEWARE =================================
Values retained in the browser are available to the user and can be manually checked.
Be careful if this can impose a security threat in your scenario.

member.name: M:MSharp.PageModule.ParameterSettings(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field you can specify the the value properties of the module.
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need to set custom attributes pr have public properties in the module which you want to initialize through tag properties / attributes.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
ValidationGroup = "Login"
ShowDescription = "true"

member.name: M:MSharp.PageSetting.Value(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field you can specify a value for the page settings key in plain text. The value can be anything based on the page settings e.g. A Module Name or simple string like "true"
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
This is a mandatory field and must be supplied when a page setting is applied
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
A menu module name for page setting LeftMenu
CategoryLeftMenu
a simple string value for page settings ShowMenu
"false"

member.name: M:MSharp.PageSettingKey.Name(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field you can specify a string type value to define the name of the page setting key which is then used on the pages
Tips:
- Use descriptive and short names
- Use Camel casing
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need to define a page setting key to be used on pages for required functionality
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
LeftMenu
TopMenu
SingleColumn

member.name: M:MSharp.ProjectRole.Name(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field you can specify a string value for name of the role. This name appears in the dropdown List of roles when you need to apply the role based security in the project
Tips:
- For the entity, you have defined this Role, must have implemented IUser interface (User entity created by default implements the IUser interface)
- You must override the GetRoles method to return the name of the role you specified here in order
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need to apply role based security in project
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
Member
Administrator
Employee
Customer

member.name: M:MSharp.ViewElement`1.ExcelTemplate(System.String)
member.summary:
This field only works on List Module Element
Specifies an alternative output format when this field is exported to Excel.
By default every field is exported to Excel as it is displayed on the screen. This field allows you to use an alternative format for the Excel file.
======== DEFAULT ================================
By default the Excel format of a field is the same as the format of the field itself.
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
Use this when you one to specify a different format string for the field when it's formatted to Excel.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
"{0:d}".FormatWith(Item.CreatedDate)
Using a custom date format
"Unexportable"
A literal string

member.name: M:MSharp.ViewElement`1.HeaderTemplate(System.String)
member.summary:
This attribute works only on List Module Element
The markup to appear in the header template of the element in the list.
List elements including button and custom elements are placed inside tag of the grid view control.
Markup / Template specified in this field will be places in of the respective tag
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you want to add a custom markup for the footer of the element in the list.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
Static Text
======== HEADING ================================
C# Expression
[*Name*]

member.name: M:MSharp.ViewElement`1.DisplayMode(MSharp.DisplayMode)
member.summary:
This field works only in List Module
This property sets the visibility options of a column in a list module. If at least one column in a list has a display mode value other than default, then
it would become possible for the users to select the columns
they would like to see in the list.
There are four possible options for this attribute:
1. Always: means this column must be always visible and users can not hide it
2. Default: the default behaviour means it will be visible, but users can hide it
3. Selectable: means this column will be initially hidden, but users can make it visible
4. Hidden: means this column will be hidden and users will not be able to make it visible.
======== DEFAULT ================================
"Default" means it will be visible, but users can hide/unhide it.
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
If you set the Display mode of one single columns, you will change the behaviour of the whole module.
Use this field when you have too many columns in a list view and want to make the visibility of some of the columns optional.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
Always
Selectable

member.name: M:MSharp.ViewElement`1.LabelText(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field you can specify the label text for this element.
Note:
- If you are manually setting this field, The system will not automatically add ":" to the end of the label.
- if you don't want to display a label then use [#EMPTY#] keyword
======== DEFAULT ================================
This is a mandatory field for the elements.
The label is set to the "Title" of the property by default.
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you want to set a custom label for the element.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
"Email Address"
c#: string.Format("Email address for {0}" + Item.Name)

member.name: M:MSharp.ViewElement`1.IsSortable(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
This field works only on List Module element
This field specifies if this field in the list is going to be sortable or not.
======== DEFAULT ================================
By default, all the data columns are sortable in the list.
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
For custom columns, or columns where being sortable does not make sense. For example columns that contain a button.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
False
Means this column should not be sortable

member.name: M:MSharp.ViewElement`1.FooterFormula(MSharp.AggregateFormula)
member.summary:
This field only Works on List Module Element
You can use this attribute to specify a formula to be displayed for a column at the footer row of a list.
The possible formulas are:
- Average
- Sum
- Max
- Min
- Count
Note: You can use this in combination with FooterDisplayFormat.
======== DEFAULT ================================
By default the FooterFormula is blank, which means no value will be displayed as the footer.
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
Use this value to specify a formula for the footers.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
Average
Displays the average of the values
Count
Display the total number of the values

member.name: M:MSharp.ViewElement`1.DisplayFormat(System.String)
member.summary:
You can specify the display format which you want to use for displaying the value of this field here. This field is useful when you want to display a Numerical, or DateTime value in a certain format. The display format string must use Composite Formating and be
compatible with format strings you would use in String.Format Method .
======== DEFAULT ================================
The default value is normally {0} which means no formatting.
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you want to display the value of a field in a format other than standard format.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
{0:0,0.00}
Displays 1,234.57
{0:dddd dd MMMM}
Displays Friday 29 August

member.name: M:MSharp.ViewElement`1.DisplayExpression(System.String)
member.summary:
The html (could be dynamic) to display the item in this element.
Note:
- If left empty the appropriate field will be added.
Supports:
1. HTML tags
2. Server tags
======== DEFAULT ================================
The default value is "blank" which means the .ToString() value of the field will be displayed.
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you want to use an alternative control for a field, or create a complex markup for a field.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
Displays the value of the "Name" field.
[*Name*]
Displays the current time and date instead of the value of the element.

member.name: M:MSharp.ViewElement`1.EmptyMarkup(System.String)
member.summary:
Use this field to specify what should be displayed when
the value for this field is empty. This is especially useful for highlighting missing data in a View or List module.
======== DEFAULT ================================
By default, the missing values will be displayed as blank.
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you want some expression to be displayed when the value of a field is empty.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================

A C# expression

member.name: M:MSharp.ViewElement`1.FooterDisplayFormat(System.String)
member.summary:
This field only Works on List Module Element
This attribute is used along with the FooterFormula.
Use this attribute to specify the format for the value you specified in the FooterFormula.
This attribute uses the Composite Formatting Numeric Format Strings.
======== DEFAULT ================================
The default value for this field is {0} which implied that it will not use any formatting for the footer and simply outputs it to the screen.
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
Use this when you want to format the result of the FooterFormula in a certain format.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
{0:C2}
Displays 123.46
{0:0,0.00}
Displays 1,234.57

member.name: M:MSharp.ViewElement`1.ViewModelType(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field, you can specify the alternative control type you wish to use for this field.

======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you want to use a control other than the Literal control for a field.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================

member.name: M:MSharp.ViewElement`1.ViewModelName(System.String)
member.summary:
An ID for when you want to specify an exact identifier for the controller you want to use in this view element.
This field is usually used in combination with ControlType to use a control type other than the Text for the view element control.
======== DEFAULT ================================
The default value for this field is null or blank.
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you want to access a control from your code behind in order to get or set a value, you can specify a ControlID to find that control.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
txtClientName
A Textbox ControlID
lstShippingMethod
A DropDownList ControlID

member.name: M:MSharp.ViewElement`1.Box(MSharp.ModuleBox)
member.summary:
In this field, you can select the box which you want this view element to be moved. You must first create at least a box in the boxes section and then set it here.
======== DEFAULT ================================
The default value for this field is blank. Which means by default, all the view elements are at the root of the module.
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you want to group a number of view elements in different box/containers in the
same view. For example, you can create a box named "Address" and then put fields like "Street", "City", Country", and "Post Code" inside that box.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
Left panel
A name of a box
"Blank"
The element will be out of the boxes.

member.name: M:MSharp.ViewElement`1.SortingStatement(System.String)
member.summary:
This field on works for list Module Element
Use this field if you want to specify a sort statement for this element other than the default sort statement.
Tips:
- Use "|" to separate multiple sort expressions.
-
You can add " DESC" to the end of each phrase to specify descending sort.
======== DEFAULT ================================
By default, the items in the List Module will be sorted based on the the default sort order of the Type.
That is, either by an explicitly defined SortOrder on that Type, or the ToString() of the object.
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you want the items in the list to be sorted differently from the default setting of the type based on this element. For example when you have a custom column that combines multiple values but you want it to be sortable based on a certain formula.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
item.LastName DESC
item.GetLastName()
item.LastName + ", " + item.FirstName

member.name: M:MSharp.ViewElement`1.CssClass(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field, you can set a css class for this element.
Tips:
- css classes should always be lower case.
- Use "-" to separate the words in the css class.
- Use " " to separate multiple css classes.
Note:
- For List elements (columns) when the Render mode is set to "Grid", use the "Grid column css class" property to set a css class for the column.
======== DEFAULT ================================
By default the element will have a css class of "item".
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When an special appearance style is needed for the element.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
add-user-button
add-button
add-user-button
c#: (Case != null) ? "case-delete-button" : ""

member.name: M:MSharp.ViewModule`1.SourceEvaluationCriteria(System.String)
member.summary:
Sometimes the DataSource of a module can only be evaluated in a special condition or otherwise it will throw an exception.
You can write such condition here, so that if your specified criteria is not met, then the DataSource expression is not even evaluated.
======== EXAMPLE ================================
Category != null
Let's say your DataSource is Category.Items, while sometimes Category can be null. In that case the DataSource would throw an exception if you didn't have this SourceEvaluationCriteria.

member.name: M:MSharp.AjaxCallActivity.ClientCallbackHandler(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field you can write code to handle the client call-back of Ajax response. Use Anonymous Type result object to retrieve values returned in server response.
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you want to update the client side based on the Ajax response.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
Example 1
$("#txtTotalAmount").val(result.Sum);
Example 2
alert(result.Sum);

member.name: M:MSharp.AjaxCallActivity.Description(System.String)
member.summary: A description for the workflow activity to document its purpose. Make your descriptions as descriptive as possible as they will be generated as Comments above your code.

member.name: M:MSharp.AjaxCallActivity.ServerSideHandler(System.String)
member.summary:
Write code to handle Server side Ajax call. Perform the server processing.Consume array of parameters and return an anonymous type object.
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
This field is mandatory.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
Example 1
var firstNumber = arguments[0]; // Retrieving Parameter
var secondNumber = arguments[1]; // Retrieving Parameter
Example 2
var result = firstNumber.To () + secondNumber.To (); // Consuming Parameters
Example 3
return new { Sum = result }; //Returning Server Response

member.name: M:MSharp.AjaxCallActivity.BreakExecution(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
If set to True, it will Restrict the execution of next actions. All the actions after this will not be executed.
======== DEFAULT ================================
True
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you want this action to stop the execution and exist the workflow

member.name: M:MSharp.AjaxCallActivity.IsDisabled(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
If set to True, it will be ignored in the code generation and as far as the target code is concerned, it won't exist.
======== DEFAULT ================================
False
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you want that this activity stops running in the project, but you do not want to delete it.

member.name: M:MSharp.AjaxCallActivity.ValidationError(System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary:
If this field is checked, the system will catch the validation exception and shows a warning to the user, instead of showing the error message on the screen.
ValidationException is a special type of exception which is usually may be thrown by the model at the time of Validation and usually means a validation error. Catching this error at the workflow level is a mean to communicate with the user about the validation problem.
======== DEFAULT ================================
True
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
Almost all the time. Unless you don't want to handle the validation exceptions in the interface.
======== OPTIONS ================================
True
Catches the validation exceptions and shows a popup message
False
Let the validation exceptions to pass through and be handled elsewhere

member.name: M:MSharp.AjaxCallActivity.UnhandledError(System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary:
If this field is checked, the system will catch all the exceptions and shows a pop-up warning to the user, instead of showing the error message on the screen.
======== DEFAULT ================================
False
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
Use this when you want to catch all the exceptions. Avoid overusing this option and use WarnOnValidationExceptions instead.
======== OPTIONS ================================
True
Shows an error message when an error happens when running this workflow step
False
Does not catch the exception and let the application catches the exception

Use this when you want to catch all the exceptions. Avoid overusing this option and use WarnOnValidationExceptions instead.
======== OPTIONS ================================
True
Shows an error message when an error happens when running this workflow step
False
Does not catch the exception and let the application catches the exception

member.name: M:MSharp.GenericActivity.Code(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field you can specify C# expression required to perform an activity on the Form
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need to perform custom actions on form objects
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
var user = User.FindByEmail(txtEmail.Text);
User.SendEmail()

False

When you need to write JavaScript code in this activity

When you don't want to generate a trigger for update panel

member.name: M:MSharp.GenericActivity.ValidationError(System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary:
If this field is checked, the system will catch the validation exception and shows a warning to the user, instead of showing the error message on the screen.
ValidationException is a special type of exception which is usually may be thrown by the model at the time of Validation and usually means a validation error. Catching this error at the workflow level is a mean to communicate with the user about the validation problem.
======== DEFAULT ================================
True
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
Almost all the time. Unless you don't want to handle the validation exceptions in the interface.
======== OPTIONS ================================
True
Catches the validation exceptions and shows a popup message
False
Let the validation exceptions to pass through and be handled elsewhere

member.name: M:MSharp.GenericActivity.UnhandledError(System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary:
If this field is checked, the system will catch all the exceptions and shows a pop-up warning to the user, instead of showing the error message on the screen.
======== DEFAULT ================================
False
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
Use this when you want to catch all the exceptions. Avoid overusing this option and use WarnOnValidationExceptions instead.
======== OPTIONS ================================
True
Shows an error message when an error happens when running this workflow step
False
Does not catch the exception and let the application catches the exception

member.name: M:MSharp.NavigateActivity.RunClientSide(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
If set to True, the action will be generated as JavaScript code which will run on client side
======== DEFAULT ================================
False
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
Most of the actions are generated appropriately as client or server side.
You can use this attribute to run any action on client side
======== EXAMPLES ===============================

member.name: M:MSharp.NavigateActivity.Permanent301Redirect(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
If set to True, the redirection response will be 301 which is a permanent redirect
======== DEFAULT ================================
False
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need to apply a redirection on the page which is moved permanently t is also the best technique to update the page link to search engines
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
You have moved your site to a new domain, and you want to make the transition as seamless as possible
You are merging two websites and want to make sure that links to outdated URLs are redirected to the correct pages.

member.name: M:MSharp.NavigateActivity.PDFCustomization(System.String)
member.summary:
In this attribute you can specify a C# code to customize the PDF which will be generated for this navigation action
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need to customize the document using PDFMaker variable
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
You want to add left margin to the PDF Document
(pdfMaker as Html2PdfConverter).PdfDocumentOptions.LeftMargin = 10;
You want to add heading to thePDF Document
(pdfMaker as Html2PdfConverter).PdfHeaderOptions.HeaderText = App.Settings.PDFTitle;

member.name: M:MSharp.NavigateActivity.Url(System.String)
member.summary:
You can enter a custom URL in this field to redirect the user to a custom page (which is not in your project)
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you want to redirect the user to a custom page not in the context of your application.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
www.google.com
string.Format("www.google.com/?q={0}", App.Context.User.UserName)

member.name: M:MSharp.NavigateActivity.Target(MSharp.OpenIn)
member.summary:
This field specifies the window in which user will be redirected.
======== DEFAULT ================================
By default, all navigation activities are opened in the same window that they are called from.
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you want to open the new page in somewhere else or in popup form.
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
Setting the Target to "New browser window" will open a new Window/tab with the specified URL.
Setting the Target to "Popup window" will open the specified URL in a Modal window.

member.name: M:MSharp.NavigateActivity.PdfFileName(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field you can specify the name of the PDF file if you want to export a PDF in this activity.
Tips:
- You must update you App.Context.User property's Get accessor to enable PDF export of secure pages.

When you want to export the target page contents in a PDF file
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
Dynamic Name
Item.Person.FullName.Replace(" ", "_") +"_" + LocalTime.Now.ToString("dd_MM_yyy@HH_mm")
Static Name
Active_Members

======== EXAMPLES ===============================
Profile Details
Product Details

Slide

700

"User ([*UserName*]) has been successfully added!"

You want to prompt validation message

member.name: M:MSharp.RuleCriterion.Roles(MSharp.ProjectRole[])
member.summary:
In this field you can select the roles to implement role based security / visibility rule
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you have defined roles in the project and want only particular role(s) to be able to access
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
You have a page with sub pages which are used to manage admin related work and only want Admin user to access it
You have a forum and want to have a delete button which only be visible to Admin users
you have a forum and only want Members of the site to post the comments.

member.name: M:MSharp.RuleCriterion.Rule(System.String)
member.summary:
In this field you can specify complex business rule to implement security on different section in the website e.g. Modules, elements, Buttons etc
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need to use the complex business rules to control the access of execution of actions in the website e.g. CanSee(), IsConnected, HasBalance etc
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
You have a social network site and want to implement restriction on member profiles to be only viewed by a connected member
App.Context.Member.IsConnected(Member)
You have an ecommerce website on which members bid for only the product which is available to bidding and hasn't won by no one.
Item.IsAvailable

member.name: M:MSharp.RuleCriterion.StandardRule(MSharp.CommonCriterion)
member.summary:
In this field you can select a standard rule to define a criteria.
======== WHEN TO USE/SET IT? ====================
When you need to implement a simple criteria based on the standard rule to apply a rule
======== EXAMPLES ===============================
You have a back button which redirect to the previous page if the request has a return URL
HasReturnURL
You have a debug page which you want to access of the the request is from local network
IsLocalRequest
